programme.desc: The moonbase radio and video links mysteriously fail, leaving Earth in a defenceless position

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Dax returns from a mission beyond the wormhole with a stowaway archaeologist on board, but it soon becomes apparent that the relic-seeker is not alone - and prankster Q could be up to his old tricks

programme.title: Primal Force (1999)
programme.desc: An emergency team leap into action to rescue the bedraggled survivors of an aeroplane accident - but their mission is hampered by the terrifying knowledge that the Mexican island they've crashed on is populated by mutant baboons. Action adventure, starring Ron Perlman, Roxana Zal, Mark Kiely and Julian Sedgwick

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month

programme.title: Bigfoot (2012)
programme.desc: A rock concert awakens the legendary monster, who goes on the rampage. The event's organiser plans to kill the beast and create a tourist attraction around its stuffed body, but an environmentalist realises the creature is the last of its species, and is determined to make sure it does not become extinct. Action adventure, starring Barry Williams, Danny Bonaduce and Sherilyn Fenn

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: En route to the Federation archives at Memory Alpha, the Enterprise encounters a strange energy field which takes over the mind of a lieutenant aboard the ship. Starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Jadzia Dax is kidnapped and accused of committing murder during her previous incarnation as womanising diplomat Curzon Dax. Sisko tries to prove she cannot be held responsible for her earlier actions, but finds Jadzia strangely unwilling to defend herself. Starring Avery Brooks and Terry Farrell

programme.title: UFO

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: Fear is the Key (1972)
programme.desc: A man gets caught up in international terrorism while avenging the death of his wife and child. Thriller based on an Alistair MacLean novel, starring Barry Newman and Ben Kingsley

programme.title: Road Train (2010)
programme.desc: Four friends driving through the Australian outback are run off the road by a lorry, which they later find has no driver. When they then witness a murder, they get on board the truck to escape, only to find the vehicle has a mind of its own and a sinister destination planned for them - as well as a terrifying cargo on board. Horror, with Bob Morley and Sophie Lowe

programme.title: The Reptile (1966)
programme.desc: A man visits Cornwall to investigate his brother's death, but encounters strange opposition from superstitious locals - and soon comes face to fang with the scaly victim of an exotic curse. Hammer horror, starring Noel Willman, Jacqueline Pearce, Ray Barrett and Jennifer Daniel

programme.title: Paranormal Activity (2007)
programme.desc: A couple move into a new house, only to be disturbed by unexplained supernatural phenomena. They become convinced the property is haunted and set out to capture evidence of their ghostly encounters on film. An attempt to directly contact the spirits only makes matters worse. Horror, starring Katie Featherston and Micah Sloat

Thriller, starring James Van Der Beek and Alexandra Castillo

programme.title: Tombstone: The Town Too Tough to Die (1942)

Western, with Richard Dix and Edgar Buchanan

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Alien delegates from the Gamma Quadrant prefer gambling in the bar to negotiation - and Quark's attempts to cheat them leave him playing a deadly game with the senior officers' lives. Starring Armin Shimerman, Avery Brooks and Nana Visitor

programme.title: UFO

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: Narrow Margin (1990)
programme.desc: A Los Angeles assistant district attorney arrives in Canada to escort the key witness in a gangland murder case back to the States. With two professional hitmen closing in, the pair take a terrifying journey through the Rockies, pursued by the assassins. Thriller remake, starring Gene Hackman, Anne Archer, JT Walsh and James B Sikking

programme.title: The One (2001)
programme.desc: An evil genius embarks on a perilous journey through a multitude of parallel universes in a bid to become all-powerful by killing every other version of him. However, he reckons without the intervention of a maverick cop determined to prevent his bid. Futuristic martial arts adventure, with Jet Li in multiple roles alongside Carla Gugino, Jason Statham and Delroy Lindo

programme.desc: A family visit the desert in their used RV, but become stranded and isolated in the scorching terrain. They soon learn the vehicle holds terrible, haunting secrets, and find themselves in the fight of their lives. Horror, starring Denise Richards, Mischa Barton and Jeff Denton

programme.title: Anna and the Apocalypse (2017)
programme.desc: When a sleepy town is hit by a zombie apocalypse, adventurous student Anna puts her plans for a gap year on hold as she and her friends get locked into a battle for survival. However, it's not all bad, as they also find time to burst into the odd musical number. Comedy horror, starring Ella Hunt, Malcolm Cumming and Sarah Swire

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Novak Djokovic will be first up on Centre Court, having won his fourth consecutive title here and his seventh overall after overcoming Nick Kyrgios in the 2022 final. Having already won the Australian and French Opens this year, Djokovic is aiming to become the first man since Rod Laver in 1969 to win all four Grand Slam events in the same year. One of his main challengers could well be Carlos Alcaraz, who is the last man other than Djokovic to win a Grand Slam, having won the US Open in 2022, which contributed to a spell at the top of the world rankings

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. In the ladies' competition, there were straight-set victories for eventual runner-up Ons Jabeur and second seed Anett Kontaveit over MIrjam Bjorklund and Bernarda Pera on day one last year. In the men's event, Wimbledon continued to be the one Grand Slam that has eluded Stan Wawrinka, when he lost 7-5, 4-6, 6-3, 6-2 to a man 17 years his junior in Jannik Sinner

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: After 15 years of fostering, Stephen and Lynn Smedley were looking forward to their well-earned retirement in Carbis Bay, Cornwall. However, the dream dramatically changed when their daughter died, leaving them caring for their three grandsons. The boys, still grieving for their mum's untimely death, are forced to share a single bedroom with a triple bunkbed. There is only one bathroom and Lynn is forced to do the ironing in the shed due to lack of space. Enter Nick Knowles and the team. Their plan is to reconfigure and enlarge their home to accommodate three growing boys - with the help of hundreds of volunteers

programme.title: We Hunt Together

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team celebrate the 75th anniversary of the National Health Service by restoring items chronicling the evolution of the publicly funded healthcare system. First into the barn are nurses Catherine and Katie who bring metal-man Dominic Chinea a Thomas the Tank Engine food trolley from the children's ward at Frimley Park Hospital in Surrey, having been a feature on the ward for over 30-years, it has started to show its age. Bookbinder Chris Shaw is given the task of repairing the daily diary kept by nurses and carers who took care of author and poet Michael Rosen while he was in a 40-day induced coma at the start of the pandemic. Dr Adrian and his daughter Lydia bring in a 1960s GP's bag that belonged to Adrian's late father Noel. Leather expert Suzie Fletcher teams up with silversmith Brenton West to repair the bag and the medical instruments inside. Will Kirk is tasked with revamping an old wooden desk that Bill saved from being thrown away when he was a student at nursing school in

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the conclusion of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the second day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Elena Rybakina is scheduled to get proceedings under way on Centre Court this afternoon following her victory over Ons Jabeur in the 2022 final. As 2021 title-winner Ashleigh Barty had retired, the honour normally reserved for the champion fell to top seed Iga Swiatek last year, and she claimed a routine 6-0, 6-3 victory over qualifier Jana Fett. She was followed by Rafael Nadal, who prevailed in four sets against Francisco Cerundolo, but the two-time champion looks set to miss out this time around due to injury

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the second day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Serena Williams was unable to add to her seven singles titles here when she fell at the first hurdle to Harmony Tan at this stage last year. However, there were victories for two other former ladies' champions, with Simona Halep and Petra Kvitova overcoming Karolina Muchova and Jasmine Paolini respectively

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Dan and Kelly Waller cleared a packed garage to create an annex for grandparents to live, but as a result the clutter that was there has now taken over the rest of the house. With Stacey's help, the family starts packing all its possessions into boxes and those are later laid out in a giant warehouse like an art installation of their entire lives. Back at the house, carpenter Robert Bent creates a multi-purpose spare room and transforms the office into a workspace of dreams, cleaner Iwan Carrington gives the home a supersize spring clean, while organiser Dilly Carter reveals the best way to organise paperwork

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: Despite the danger that leaving the cell puts him in, Mobeen heads to see Jamal in response to a call for help - only to encounter Megalodon on the way. Just when it looks like Megalodon is about to batter Mobeen, Officer Saj intervenes, leaving Mobeen free to help Jamal, which he does with help from an unlikely source. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Youssef Kerkour

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: Megalodon throws the prison into a full-blown riot. Mobeen, Nate and Harper split off into different groups. Mobeen is concerned with Dr Nida's safety, while also trying to keep Memory Stick on side. Uncle Shady ends up with Memory Stick, with both of them trying to evade Megalodon and a wing full of rioting inmates. However, as the Tornado Team arrives, Mobeen ends up in the climactic showdown in which a number of revelations emerge. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Youssef Kerkour

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Sam and Jay travel to where Sam's mother died to see if she's now a ghost, while Sasappis divulges a secret to his fellow ghosts that he overheard Sam and Jay discussing

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: When Jay's sister comes to visit Sam and Jay after being dumped by her boyfriend, they're shocked to discover that she's communicating with someone they know on a dating app

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A group of students face life-threatening weather on a hike and twin sisters survive a house fire thanks to their dogs alerting them to the flames

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers worry about one of their older cheetahs as they notice he has lost weight and his teeth are worn down. When they discover he has chronic kidney failure, they do their best to keep him hydrated but struggle to get him to drink more water. Kate finds out how the keepers are gaining the trust of their hyenas, Ben helps the emus cool off and Hamza spends an hour getting up close and personal with a Rothschild giraffe

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents live coverage of the third day from the All England Club, where the second round is scheduled to get under way in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Third seed Casper Ruud was an early casualty on day three last year, losing 3-6, 6-2, 7-5, 6-4 to Ugo Humbert

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather

programme.title: A Scottish Service of Thanksgiving for King Charles III
programme.desc: King Charles III and Queen Camilla are presented with the Honours of Scotland

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents further live coverage of the third day from the All England Club, featuring second-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. British number one Emma Raducanu's tournament came to an abrupt end at this stage last year when she was beaten 6-3, 6-3 by France's Caroline Garcia. However, there was better news for the home crowd on the No. 1 Court, where ninth seed Cameron Norrie prevailed in five sets against Jaume Munar of Spain

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents, as live coverage of the third day concludes at the All England Club, where second-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions take place. Two-time champion and home favourite Andy Murray's tournament came to an end at this stage last year on Centre Court when he was beaten in four sets by American John Isner, who is perhaps best known for winning the longest professional tennis match in history here in 2010 against Nicolas Mahut

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: As they compete for a place in the quarter final, Sara Pascoe takes the sewers back to the 1990s. In the Pattern Challenge, the competitors make the most popular trousers of the decade, cargo pants, before rustling up a '90s celebrity-themed fancy dress outfit in the Transformation Challenge. In the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers make dresses fit for a '90s supermodel

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Medical doctors, science broadcasters and identical twins Chris and Xand van Tulleken team up to research their family tree. They grew up surrounded by old paintings and documents commemorating characters from their Dutch ancestry, but despite this wealth of family archive, the twins know little about their heritage. Their journey takes them back to the Netherlands, where they look into the career of sea captain Jan Tulleken, their four-times great-grandfather, a staunch royalist who joined the Dutch navy at 13. But as they trace the story back, they reveal a troubling story

programme.title: The Railway Man (2013)
programme.desc: A traumatised former prisoner of war gets married, but continues to suffer nightmares about his experiences. He is unable to talk to his wife about his time in captivity, so she tracks down a fellow hostage to learn the truth - and discovers the cruel Japanese officer he is fixated on is still alive. Fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Nicole Kidman and Stellan Skarsgard

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from London's Docklands to the Barbican, examining the story of the arrival at Tilbury in 1948 of the Empire Windrush, which brought more than a thousand passengers from the Caribbean to work in Britain. In Limehouse, Michael reflects on the Labour Party's landslide victory at the post-war general election of 1945 and hears what drove new prime minister Clement Attlee to strive for social change

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: With plenty of fledglings, Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are keeping up with the comings and goings at RSPB Arne in Dorset. Megan McCubbin revels in a botany bonanza at Durlston Country Park, a national nature reserve on the Isle of Purbeck, which in the spring is simply buzzing with life, while Gillian Burke heads to Anglesey

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Emma Raducanu delighted the home crowd on Centre Court on day one last year, with the 2021 US Open winner prevailing 6-4, 6-4 against Belgium's Alison Van Uytvanck. She was followed by another hugely popular player here in two-time champion Andy Murray, who triumphed 4-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-4 against Australian James Duckworth, and there was further British success over on the No. 2 Court, with Cameron Norrie beating Spain's Pablo Andujar 6-0, 7-6, 6-3. On the No. 1 Court, there was a 6-0, 7-5 victory for Germany's 2018 champion Angelique Kerber against Kristina Mladenovic of France

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim's anxiety soars on the day of her sentencing and Howie confides in Denise. Stacey and Martin worry about Lily who is suddenly not feeling well just before the family conference. Elaine asks the Knight girls to be her bridesmaids

programme.title: Your Body Uncovered with Kate Garraway
programme.desc: Kate meets Judith, a singer who has been delaying treatment for a thyroid nodule for fear it may damage her voice and in turn her career. She hopes a three dimensional look at the growth in her neck will help her understand why surgery is the best option to treat her condition. Elsewhere, Kate meets Melina, whose love for good food has been curtailed because of agonising gallstone attacks

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the opening day's play at the All England Club, where the first round got under way in the men's and ladies' singles. Novak Djokovic was scheduled on Centre Court to begin the defence of the title he won in the last four stagings of the event

programme.title: Dry Your Eyes
programme.desc: Northern Irish comedy sketch show, featuring a woman obsessed with calling the police for trivial reasons, and a needy checkout girl who cannot cope with rejection - even if it's just the offer of a loyalty card. Plus, a parody of Line of Duty, in which a Northern Irish detective based in England can always get a confession by being incomprehensible to his suspects

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Beguiled (2017)
programme.desc: A girls' school in Confederate Virginia continues running through the American Civil War, but the peaceful order is disturbed by the arrival of an injured Union deserter. The soldier is taken in for medical treatment, but his presence inspires jealousy, betrayal and desire among teachers and students alike. Period drama based on the novel by Thomas Cullinan, starring Colin Farrell, Nicole Kidman and Kirsten Dunst

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Rare Breed Survival Trust, a charity founded by his father to reverse the decline of rare breed numbers in the UK. With summer temperatures rising, Adam welcomes a shearing gang on site to remove the coats of his commercial sheep, and is visited by the Chief Executive of the British Pig Association. Plus, a Gloucester Bull is prepared for a day at a country show

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The school launches its new radio station and Danny uses it as a chance to try to make amends. Myles's actions catch up with him and he is alienated by his peers. Nicky butts heads with Kai while she battles with guilt and Preston is forced to face his demons

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: Rav Wilding investigates the noise-detecting cameras being used to tackle anti-social drivers, the importance of fingerprint evidence and how 3D graphics are used in courtrooms

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits several of London's most famous locations, beginning on the South Bank, where the 1951 Festival of Britain drew more than eight and a half million visitors to admire fantastical buildings designed to inspire and celebrate the best of British in art, science and industry. After a spin on the London Eye, built to celebrate the millennium, Michael takes the London Underground to Chelsea to find out about Elizabeth David, one of the most influential cookery writers of the 20th century, and also heads to Covent Garden and Regent's Park

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the teams at work at the 'big houses' of Northern Ireland. Highlights of the final episode include the battle to save unique dodo and dinosaur statues in a garden, the hidden story behind a portrait, and a Victorian garden seat's restoration to its former glory

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the second day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. British wild card Paul Jubb produced a valiant effort on day two last year before falling in five sets to eventual runner-up Nick Kyrgios of Australia. The contest was followed on the no.3 Court by another five-setter, with America's Maxime Cressy eventually getting the better of Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime. Elsewhere, home favourite Heather Watson came back from a set down to defeat Tamara Korpatsch of Germany, but her compatriot Dan Evans lost in straight sets to Australian qualifier Jason Kubler. There was also a victory for American star Coco Gauff, playing in her third Wimbledon at the age of just 18, against Elena-Gabriela Ruse of Romania, while talented Greek player Stefanos Tsitsipas advanced at the expense of Switzerland's Alexander Ritschard

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the second day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A nervous Lily and Ricky attend the family conference with their social workers and Theo offers to tutor Lily for free while she is off school. Patrick arrives home to a surprise and Whitney plans a moving in party for Zack. Elaine helps the other future brides of Walford by making a 'Bride Club'

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: After renting for many years in London, actress Jill Halfpenny and her 13-year-old son Harvey made the big decision to start a new life in the North East, where Jill was brought up. They both love the sea views of their new home in Tynemouth, but the flat's layout is revealing its glitches. The kitchen is right at the back of the property, making it feel dark and disconnected, the bathroom has no windows and the only outside space is a tiny balcony. Using virtual reality techniques, architects Will Foster and Lynsey Elliot compete to remodel the property

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the second day's play at the All England Club, where the first round continued in the men's and ladies' singles. Reigning ladies' champion Elena Rybakina was among those set to be in action on Centre Court today, as she began her bid to become the first woman to retain the title since Serena Williams in 2016

programme.title: Famalam
programme.desc: Highlights from the comedy sketch show, including an overprotective boyfriend meeting his match and Scribbler P giving an important lesson on military history. The competitive aunties cause havoc, Midsomer receives an injection of diversity as Detective Mountree solves a whodunit in a stately home and Fantastic Egusi Films give their inimitable rendition of a Hollywood blockbuster. Starring Vivienne Acheampong, Gbemisola Ikumelo, Samson Kayo, John Macmillan, Tom Moutchi and Akemnji Ndifornyen

programme.title: The Program (2015)
programme.desc: A journalist follows Lance Armstrong's rise to dominance in the world of professional cycling, even following a successful battle with cancer. As time goes on, he begins to suspect the champion is boosting his performance with drugs, and in the face of condemnation from the media he sets out to expose the truth. Fact-based drama, starring Ben Foster, Chris O'Dowd and Dustin Hoffman

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: Instances involving ordinary beat coppers that helped bring major criminals to justice. A suspicious police officer discovers a crooked solicitor is facilitating sham marriages for money, a poaching complaint leads officers to a hidden drug's den and an international smuggler and a dodgy number plate sends officers on a high-speed pursuit and arrest of an armed criminal

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Children's week, Sara Pascoe invites the seven remaining sewers to create a dragon dressing gown using thick towelling fabric and including tricky details like dragon spikes, neat binding and a googly-eyed hood. In the Transformation Challenge, the sewers personalise some hand-me-down denim jackets before welcoming some mini-models for the Made to Measure challenge in which the contestants make a party-ready outfit for a five-year-old

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures deep underground onto London's newest railway - the Elizabeth Line - enjoying a smooth ride from Paddington to Tottenham Court Road. Emerging into the sunshine in Bedford Square, Michael recalls the choking smogs which plagued the capital during the 1950s. He learns how smoke-free zones were introduced to tackle the problem and, high above the capital at the top of the BT Tower, discovers how the capital's air quality is monitored today

Briony-May Williams explores how Somerset is rivalling France in cheese productions, and Onkar Singh Purewal discovers the secrets of beekeeping

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the third day from the All England Club, featuring the second round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Novak Djokovic continued his march to a fourth successive title at this stage last year with a routine 6-1, 6-4, 6-2 victory over Thanasi Kokkinakis on Centre Court. Over on the No.1 Court, there was an upset when second seed Anett Kontaveit was beaten 6-4, 6-0 by Jule Niemeier in her first match against a top 10 player. That match was followed by a 7-6, 7-5 win for 2021 runner-up Karolina Pliskova against Tereza Martincova. Meanwhile, there were mixed fortunes for two former champions on Court No.2, with Garbine Muguruza losing 6-4, 6-0 to Greet Minnen, and Angelique Kerber prevailing 6-3, 6-3 against Magda Linette

programme.desc: Martin digs for information on Theo by going to Freddie. Ravi starts playing games with Chelsea at Zack's party and Patrick sets Jack on a mission to make Denise relax. The first session of Elaine's Bride Club doesn't quite go to plan

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the River Annan in Dumfries and Galloway, following it from where it rises above the Devil's Beef Tub, all the way to the Solway Firth. On the way he samples some dubious-smelling 'healthy' spa water, discovers the explosive devil's porridge and follows in the footsteps of Robert Burns by taking a dunk in the briny close to where the river meets the sea. He then turns his attention to the Esk, which rises in the Portland Hills just south of Edinburgh

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon

programme.desc: Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders pay comic homage to the hit road movie Thelma & Louise. They are also joined by Royal Ballet stars Darcey Bussell and Anthony Dowell

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to local experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: Inside the Iranian Uprising
programme.desc: In September 2022, a 22-year-old Iranian woman, Mahsa Amini, died in police custody. She had been arrested by Iran's religious police, accused of not wearing her hijab properly. The authorities said she had died of a heart attack, but rumours spread that she had been beaten on arrest. Furious citizens took to the streets in their thousands. In a country with no freedom of speech or free reporting, they filmed themselves. This documentary reveals what has been happening across Iran, revealing a regime under huge pressure, resorting to extreme cruelty to control its citizens

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: The team follow first-time deaf festival-goers at Glastonbury, as well as those who have been going for 42 years. Yvonne Cobb and Julian Peedle-Calloo also mark the 25th anniversary of Refugee Week, which celebrates the creativity and resilience of refugees and people seeking sanctuary

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: IT project manager Lee and actor Darren remodel their 1960s house in Southampton, after choosing a design using virtual reality. Architects Laura Jane Clark and Damion Burrows go head to head pitching their unique designs to the couple, with Laura Jane drawing inspiration from the property's original features and Damion planning to open up the house, giving it a better connection to the garden

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An everyday burglary solves a series of dramatic ram-raids, a minor theft leads to a kidnapping conviction, and a consumer complaint leads to the arrest of prolific fraudsters

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels though Cumbria, setting sail in a small craft on Lake Windermere with a lifelong devotee of Arthur Ransome's children's books Swallows and Amazons. At Barrow-in-Furness, Michael investigates the mountains of scrap left behind as iron ore was turned into ships, trains and railway tracks, and discovers researchers are exploring how slagbanks could contribute to reducing atmospheric carbon dioxide.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The Wonder of Bees with Martha Kearney
programme.desc: The journalist reflects on the success of her mission to harvest true wildflower honey as she offers her wares to the public at a village fair, before she concludes her year-long beekeeping adventure with a visit to Cornwall's Tregothnan Estate - where she discovers the secrets of the highly prized manuka honey

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred navigates Snowdonia and the Llanberis Pass, before starting his journey from Bolton to Buckingham Palace to collect his MBE

programme.title: Attenborough and the Giant Dinosaur
programme.desc: The story of how more than 220 dinosaur bones were found in the Argentinean desert, which were found to have come from a previously undiscovered species, which is the largest land dwelling animal known to have existed. David Attenborough visits the archaeological dig and a laboratory where the remains are being cleaned and analysed with lead scientist Dr Diego Pol and evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod, and meets animators, model-makers, paleontologists and anatomy experts who are working to reconstruct what the 37 metre-long creature would have looked like

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part two of two. Liz Bonnin joins the palaeontologists as they unearth the remains of fearsome Jurassic predators, with the team considering if the site was a dinosaur hunting ground. They try to figure out if these predators were involved in the deaths of supersized beasts like the diplodocus buried at the site, helping to reveal why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary series reaches the Cretaceous period, 75 million years ago, when Earth was dominated by the last generation of gigantic carnivores that took killing to a new level. They included the daspletosaurus, which hunted in gangs and used its highly developed smell and hearing to take down opponents like the horned rhino-sized chasmosuarus. Also featured is the sharp-toothed majungasaurus, a predator of much smaller creatures that would occasionally turn cannibal and hunt its own kind

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary series reaches the Jurassic period, when the first giant killers stalked Earth and lurked in the seas. North America was dominated by the allosaurus, an ambush hunter with a lethal bite, allowing it to bring down even the heavily armoured stegosaurus. Life in the oceans was just as deadly - a fossil found in the Arctic in 2008 turned out to be a colossal marine reptile. Named Predator X, the creature was 50ft long, weighed 45 tons and had a bite force unmatched by anything in the Jurassic seas

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Water-dwelling giants of the late Jurassic period, when the Earth's coastlines were reshaped by a steady rise in sea levels and thousands of square miles of land were flooded. These shallow seas supported a revolution in marine life, and reptiles such as plesiosaurs shared the water with liopleurodon, the largest carnivore on the planet

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Flying reptiles from the early Cretaceous period, known as pterosaurs, which had small bodies and hollow bones, and flew by means of wings covered with a membrane. Most pterosaurs could stay airborne under their own power, but the largest ones, with a wingspan of up to 11 metres, probably relied on thermal currents

programme.title: Magic Numbers: Hannah Fry's Mysterious World of Maths
programme.desc: Dr Hannah Fry travels down the fastest zip-wire in the world to learn more about Newton's ideas on gravity and discusses why maths is so good at predicting the world around us

programme.title: The Wonder of Bees with Martha Kearney
programme.desc: The journalist reflects on the success of her mission to harvest true wildflower honey as she offers her wares to the public at a village fair, before she concludes her year-long beekeeping adventure with a visit to Cornwall's Tregothnan Estate - where she discovers the secrets of the highly prized manuka honey

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred navigates Snowdonia and the Llanberis Pass, before starting his journey from Bolton to Buckingham Palace to collect his MBE

programme.title: Attenborough and the Giant Dinosaur
programme.desc: The story of how more than 220 dinosaur bones were found in the Argentinean desert, which were found to have come from a previously undiscovered species, which is the largest land dwelling animal known to have existed. David Attenborough visits the archaeological dig and a laboratory where the remains are being cleaned and analysed with lead scientist Dr Diego Pol and evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod, and meets animators, model-makers, paleontologists and anatomy experts who are working to reconstruct what the 37 metre-long creature would have looked like

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part two of two. Liz Bonnin joins the palaeontologists as they unearth the remains of fearsome Jurassic predators, with the team considering if the site was a dinosaur hunting ground. They try to figure out if these predators were involved in the deaths of supersized beasts like the diplodocus buried at the site, helping to reveal why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: The NHS: A People's History
programme.desc: Alex Brooker continues to chart the history of the NHS via the treasured mementoes and personal stories of patients and staff, focusing on the period between 1973 and 1997. Among the artefacts are the personal letters of Dr Elphis Christopher, a family planning specialist who received death threats when she dared advocate sex education in school, and the NHS wigs given to Grand National-winning jockey Bob Champion when he underwent a then-revolutionary form of chemotherapy for testicular cancer

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Hancock decides to invest in a new camera - which Sid sees as the perfect opportunity to make some money. Classic comedy from the pen of Galton and Simpson, starring Tony Hancock and Sidney James. Originally broadcast in 1960

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob and Terry decide to chat up a couple of girls in a restaurant to see if they are still attractive to the opposite sex. Comedy, starring James Bolam and Rodney Bewes

programme.title: Eric & Ernie
programme.desc: Drama charting the early years of one of Britain's best comedy double acts, focusing on the influence of Eric Morecambe's mother Sadie (Victoria Wood). A chance meeting on the children's variety circuit sees the start of an unlikely friendship and Eric soon becomes the funnyman to Ernie Wise's 'feed'. But as they grow older, the duo struggle to make their way in mainstream entertainment with a few dubious tours and an ill-advised TV series that has the critics gunning for them. Daniel Rigby and Bryan Dick star as Eric and Ernie, with Jim Moir (better known to comedy fans as Vic Reeves) and Reece Shearsmith as their fathers

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Looking at the surprising story of the diesel engine - a 19th-century invention that is the hidden powerhouse behind the globalised world and is now indispensable. Car enthusiast Mark Evans gets hands on with Rudolf Diesel's original creation, including vintage submarines, tractors, locomotive trains and container ships

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part documentary, Robert Winston explores the treatment of ailments before the advent of the National Health Service, revealing that few could afford to seek medical attention in the early 20th century. Archive footage and personal testimonies tell how ordinary people, doctors and nurses coped with a system ill-equipped to deal with sickness and disease in the years preceding the Second World War

programme.title: Magic Numbers: Hannah Fry's Mysterious World of Maths
programme.desc: As her journey examining whether maths was invented or discovered concludes, Mathematician Dr Hannah Fry explores a paradox at the heart of modern maths, and what maths can reveal about the fundamental building blocks of the universe

programme.title: Eric & Ernie
programme.desc: Drama charting the early years of one of Britain's best comedy double acts, focusing on the influence of Eric Morecambe's mother Sadie (Victoria Wood). A chance meeting on the children's variety circuit sees the start of an unlikely friendship and Eric soon becomes the funnyman to Ernie Wise's 'feed'. But as they grow older, the duo struggle to make their way in mainstream entertainment with a few dubious tours and an ill-advised TV series that has the critics gunning for them. Daniel Rigby and Bryan Dick star as Eric and Ernie, with Jim Moir (better known to comedy fans as Vic Reeves) and Reece Shearsmith as their fathers

programme.title: The NHS: A People's History
programme.desc: Alex Brooker continues to chart the history of the NHS via the treasured mementoes and personal stories of patients and staff, focusing on the period between 1973 and 1997. Among the artefacts are the personal letters of Dr Elphis Christopher, a family planning specialist who received death threats when she dared advocate sex education in school, and the NHS wigs given to Grand National-winning jockey Bob Champion when he underwent a then-revolutionary form of chemotherapy for testicular cancer

programme.title: The NHS: A People's History
programme.desc: Patients and staff tell their stories from 1997 to the present day, a period in which the NHS has grown unwieldy and almost impossibly expensive to manage. A host of unique, highly personal artefacts, are unearthed, including the homemade badges dedicated to the first surgeons to carry out gender reassignment surgery after it became available on the NHS and a nurse's uniform cherished since it was used in the opening ceremony of the 2012 Olympics

programme.title: Florence Nightingale: Nursing Pioneer
programme.desc: A profile of the woman who revolutionised modern nursing and reformed healthcare at home and abroad. The documentary follows her life, from being born into a rich English family, and revealing how she broke through social and gender barriers to pioneer a profession previously reserved for men. Dedicating her life to helping those in need, she was a trailblazer who led a group of nurses to care for wounded soldiers during the Crimean War and developed revolutionary views about hygiene and sanitation, going on to establish a training school and reform healthcare at home and abroad

programme.title: Black Nurses: The Women Who Saved the NHS
programme.desc: The story of the thousands of Caribbean and African women who answered the call more than 70 years ago to come to the UK and help build the National Health Service. Told by the women themselves, the documentary reveals the price they paid in leaving behind their families, and examines their struggle to overcome racism and their fight for career progression, as well as their cultural impact here and abroad

programme.title: Food for Ravens
programme.desc: Play focusing on Nye Bevan's final days as he muses on his life and career from his death bed in Buckinghamshire. Taking its title from a seventh-century Welsh poem, the representation shows the complexities of the man who, although rooted in the working class, was deeply influenced by glamorous world figures. Brian Cox stars in this 2008 drama, being shown again to mark the 75th anniversary of the NHS

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: The documentary exploring health care before the arrival of the NHS concludes, revealing how Victorian hospitals - often seen as a last resort for the destitute rather than a place of healing - transformed into the modern centres of medicine they have become today. Includes archive footage and first-hand accounts from patients, doctors and nurses from an era when infectious disease was virtually untreatable. Narrated by Robert Winston

programme.title: Florence Nightingale: Nursing Pioneer
programme.desc: A profile of the woman who revolutionised modern nursing and reformed healthcare at home and abroad. The documentary follows her life, from being born into a rich English family, and revealing how she broke through social and gender barriers to pioneer a profession previously reserved for men. Dedicating her life to helping those in need, she was a trailblazer who led a group of nurses to care for wounded soldiers during the Crimean War and developed revolutionary views about hygiene and sanitation, going on to establish a training school and reform healthcare at home and abroad

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: The oil palm is a remarkable tree, with an incredibly diverse fruit that can be used for many different things - from shampoo and soap to toothpaste, crisps and chocolate. Unfortunately, the spread of this remarkable plant is leading to the destruction of the rainforests, particularly in Borneo and Sumatra. So what can we do? Firstly, learn where your food is coming from. Pay attention to the labels and look out for sustainable palm oil. We cant get rid of palm oil altogether as it is in countless products, and many of the alternatives would be worse. But there are different ways of making palm oil, some of which will not completely destroy the forests. The next thing you could do is buy some forest for yourself. It is possible to fundraise, to get money to purchase a piece of perfect rainforest and protect it. So why not see if you can wash cars, and buy a piece of forest the size of your classroom, the size of your assembly hall, possibly even the size of your school. Finally, think

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The National Health Service is turning 75, and we are celebrating! In this special episode, Dr Xand discovers a time machine inside the cupboard of everything and embarks upon a journey through time with Mr Grumbles. He finds out what life was like before the NHS, and how its arrival changed the health of people all over the UK. Dr Chris catches up with Ouchers to hear their NHS stories, and Dr Ronx is on a mission to award Ouch Hero medals to thank incredible hospital staff for their service. Happy birthday, NHS!

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: How did the NHS come into being? When was the first kidney transplant? Is half a chicken actually a cure for anything? Find out as comedian and former psychiatric nurse Jo Brand joins Rattus to host a special episode in honour of the NHSs 75th birthday. They discover how the NHS came to be, some of its weirder moments, and what life was like before we had the NHS to look after us. Did you know that before the NHS, getting medical help could be both difficult and expensive? We take a look at the role of the almoner, who decided who would have to pay for their treatment, and how much, before Nye Bevan comes along with his notion of free health care for all. We learn the story of the first NHS baby (and how she was encouraged to wait a few minutes before actually coming into the world), of how nurses were recruited in large numbers and how, with ventures such as the Common Cold Unit, the NHS tried to learn about how our health could be improved using some weird and wonderful methods. programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say blanket, and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of different blankets a blue blanket, a baby blanket, a woolly blanket and a picnic blanket! Dee hops around on a patchwork blanket, and we see her and a friend wrap up in a warm blanket. The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way, and everyone has a boogie when Dees friend finally succeeds in saying todays word!

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The letters introduce Y and Z, and the words zap, yak, yap, yell, jazz and zigzag

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Pug is being competitive when he cleans the bookshop. He and Dog join a race in Australia. They help brother and sister Kangaroos who are very competitive, but get stuck in the mud. The race is won by a Koala on a skateboard who overtakes everyone.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog blows up balloons for Tino's birthday, but the squirrels are worried because the artistic mouse is known for being somewhat grumpy

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster, Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny and Bad Idea Puppy arrive at Elder Kitten's house with a cart full of decorating things. It's Makeover Day, and they want to make over Elder Kitten's living room while he gets a relaxing makeover himself at the Fluffytown spa. When they finish, Love Monster thinks it's very different from Elder Kitten's usual style. He starts to wonder whether Elder Kitten will be good surprised or bad surprised. Just then, Elder Kitten returns from his spa day. Bad Idea Puppy and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny show him his new living room and explain that they decorated with the best bright things they could think of. As Elder Kitten looks on a little unsure, Love Monster asks him whether he loves it. Elder Kitten is a little lost for words and, not wanting to hurt their feelings, he simply agrees with them that it's bright and very different. Love Monster can tell that Elder Kitten doesn't like it, and eventually Elder Kitten gently admits that it's not really his style

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: The Colourblocks meet a new animal - but what colour is it? Learn about a creature that can change colour with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: It's a hot day, so Justin and his friends cool off by visiting an ice cream farm. Meanwhile, Mr Tumble tries to keep Spotty cool but can't seem to control his hose pipe!

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po receive a call on the Tubby Phone. It's the Tiddlytubbies who ring to say hello, just before the Tubby Phone Dance

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: A toy dinosaur rampages through the supermarket and scares the Grape Kids, but Carrot and Supertato work out it is remote-controlled and try to get it back in its box

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Glitch causes catastrophe on Whistler Mountain in Canada in a cable car hanging from a wire stretching three kilometres across the valley, higher than the Eiffel Tower

programme.title: Apple Tree House
programme.desc: A new arrival at Sam's flat causes a great deal of excitement

programme.title: Andy's Safari Adventures
programme.desc: Andy Day jets off to Africa's Sahara Desert in search of a naked mole rat. His mission takes him into its underground burrow

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: Gem and her teams of Swashbucklers try to win her jewels back from pirates Cook, Line and Sinker. Game show for children

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee has a big paddling pool and enlists the help of Ethel the elephant in blowing it up and filling it with water so the gang can have fun

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When Benjamin is impressed by Lily's cleverness, Peter thinks they no longer need him in their gang - but he soon changes his mind

programme.title: Andy's Safari Adventures
programme.desc: When Andy destroys a salty rock that Mr Hammond had collected for the mountain goat enclosure, Andy must head off to the Rocky Mountains of North America in search of a new one. Along the way he meets a pika and some bighorn sheep before climbing a mountain to find the goats. Will Andy find a new rock? And will he get back to Safari World in time?

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When a giant wave hurls Amazon River creatures up into the trees, the Octonauts must get them down safely, without disturbing poison dart frogs who live there

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo makes everything heavy with a swish of her wand

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea asks for flying lessons when Broccoli flies her paper plane into her freezer. Evil Pea doesnt let Broccoli know that she intends to fly high to take over Tato Tower

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The four superheroes take part in a disco-dazzling around the world game show

programme.title: Apple Tree House
programme.desc: Sam finds out that Annie is having trouble sleeping because of bad dreams

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: It's the hottest day of the year and Waffle is eating ice cream to cool down. Outside in the sweltering heat, Simon turns on the sprinkler to help everyone cool down, but poor Waffle doesn't like the sprinkler and darts through the hole in the fence to Mrs Hobbs's garden, looking for shade. The Brooklyn-Bells try to coax him back, but he refuses to return. Doug decides to make a mini swimming pool by filling the ball pit with cool water. Waffle loves swimming pools. Maybe that will encourage him back?

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: The Ribbon sisters invite Sarah and her feathered friend to the park for their favourite seasonal event

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo & Gran Gran go to the Library and JoJo gets her first ever library card!

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Pepi Nana finds a set of picture cards on the toy house kitchen table. The pictures are of Pepi Nana doing her favourite things

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Major Clanger is making too much noise in his workshop and Mother is fed up with it. She suggests they should swap jobs

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: The Pontipines are left behind after everyone goes for a ride on the Ninky Nonk, but when they eventually catch it, they find a special carriage to ride in

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: A tale is read for younger viewers before they go to bed

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A man narrowly escapes death in a remote ravine after his dog alerts local walkers of his plight, and a car enthusiast faces dire consequences when he buys back a favourite motor

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate helps put a lion pride into another lion's territory to analyse the current social structure. The keepers carry out essential health checks on the park's new red pandas

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit a three-bedroom terrace in Rugby, a former working men's club in Bolsover and a three bedroom semi in Nottingham which are all up for sale at online auctions. The team follows progress on building work to see if any of the developers can turn a profit on their investments

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents today's show from Hele in Devon, and visits a Victorian catacomb. The reds and the blues are led by John Cameron and Stephanie Connell

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Novak Djokovic will be first up on Centre Court, having won his fourth consecutive title here and his seventh overall after overcoming Nick Kyrgios in the 2022 final. Having already won the Australian and French Opens this year, Djokovic is aiming to become the first man since Rod Laver in 1969 to win all four Grand Slam events in the same year. One of his main challengers could well be Carlos Alcaraz, who is the last man other than Djokovic to win a Grand Slam, having won the US Open in 2022, which contributed to a spell at the top of the world rankings

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. In the ladies' competition, there were straight-set victories for eventual runner-up Ons Jabeur and second seed Anett Kontaveit over MIrjam Bjorklund and Bernarda Pera on day one last year. In the men's event, Wimbledon continued to be the one Grand Slam that has eluded Stan Wawrinka, when he lost 7-5, 4-6, 6-3, 6-2 to a man 17 years his junior in Jannik Sinner

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: After 15 years of fostering, Stephen and Lynn Smedley were looking forward to their well-earned retirement in Carbis Bay, Cornwall. However, the dream dramatically changed when their daughter died, leaving them caring for their three grandsons. The boys, still grieving for their mum's untimely death, are forced to share a single bedroom with a triple bunkbed. There is only one bathroom and Lynn is forced to do the ironing in the shed due to lack of space. Enter Nick Knowles and the team. Their plan is to reconfigure and enlarge their home to accommodate three growing boys - with the help of hundreds of volunteers

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Lola and Jackson find one thing they can agree on after interviewing Freddy. Freddy and Baba seize upon an opportunity to solve two problems with another killing

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team celebrate the 75th anniversary of the National Health Service by restoring items chronicling the evolution of the publicly funded healthcare system. First into the barn are nurses Catherine and Katie who bring metal-man Dominic Chinea a Thomas the Tank Engine food trolley from the children's ward at Frimley Park Hospital in Surrey, having been a feature on the ward for over 30-years, it has started to show its age. Bookbinder Chris Shaw is given the task of repairing the daily diary kept by nurses and carers who took care of author and poet Michael Rosen while he was in a 40-day induced coma at the start of the pandemic. Dr Adrian and his daughter Lydia bring in a 1960s GP's bag that belonged to Adrian's late father Noel. Leather expert Suzie Fletcher teams up with silversmith Brenton West to repair the bag and the medical instruments inside. Will Kirk is tasked with revamping an old wooden desk that Bill saved from being thrown away when he was a student at nursing school in

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam create a woodland garden with a gothic twist in Pershore, on a budget of 5,000 from a plot with nothing in it but a shed and a gas tank

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A dad performs CPR on his toddler with help from a 999 call handler and emergency services rush to help a retired man who crash landed his aircraft in a field

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The zookeepers notice that the wolves have been digging a lot just recently, causing them to suspect that the mother of the pack could be pregnant. Ben Fogle gets an update on three-year-old tiger Yuki and Kate Humble mourns the loss of one of the park's legendary animals

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the second day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Elena Rybakina is scheduled to get proceedings under way on Centre Court this afternoon following her victory over Ons Jabeur in the 2022 final. As 2021 title-winner Ashleigh Barty had retired, the honour normally reserved for the champion fell to top seed Iga Swiatek last year, and she claimed a routine 6-0, 6-3 victory over qualifier Jana Fett. She was followed by Rafael Nadal, who prevailed in four sets against Francisco Cerundolo, but the two-time champion looks set to miss out this time around due to injury

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the second day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Serena Williams was unable to add to her seven singles titles here when she fell at the first hurdle to Harmony Tan at this stage last year. However, there were victories for two other former ladies' champions, with Simona Halep and Petra Kvitova overcoming Karolina Muchova and Jasmine Paolini respectively

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Dan and Kelly Waller cleared a packed garage to create an annex for grandparents to live, but as a result the clutter that was there has now taken over the rest of the house. With Stacey's help, the family starts packing all its possessions into boxes and those are later laid out in a giant warehouse like an art installation of their entire lives. Back at the house, carpenter Robert Bent creates a multi-purpose spare room and transforms the office into a workspace of dreams, cleaner Iwan Carrington gives the home a supersize spring clean, while organiser Dilly Carter reveals the best way to organise paperwork

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Lady Bigfoot
programme.desc: A lonely Bigfoot who is secretly living in a Welsh woodland is warned by her best friend of a crypto-zoologist who is determined to prove her existence. Comedy starring Anna Thomas

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean rewinds the most amusing and engaging snippets from more than half a century of TV broadcasting in Wales. This time she looks at how people are prepared to go all-out for a good cause. The Welsh always go that extra mile, whether it's by running, climbing a mountain on stilts - or even printing a saucy calendar

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: Despite the danger that leaving the cell puts him in, Mobeen heads to see Jamal in response to a call for help - only to encounter Megalodon on the way. Just when it looks like Megalodon is about to batter Mobeen, Officer Saj intervenes, leaving Mobeen free to help Jamal, which he does with help from an unlikely source. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Youssef Kerkour

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: Megalodon throws the prison into a full-blown riot. Mobeen, Nate and Harper split off into different groups. Mobeen is concerned with Dr Nida's safety, while also trying to keep Memory Stick on side. Uncle Shady ends up with Memory Stick, with both of them trying to evade Megalodon and a wing full of rioting inmates. However, as the Tornado Team arrives, Mobeen ends up in the climactic showdown in which a number of revelations emerge. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Youssef Kerkour

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Sam and Jay travel to where Sam's mother died to see if she's now a ghost, while Sasappis divulges a secret to his fellow ghosts that he overheard Sam and Jay discussing

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: When Jay's sister comes to visit Sam and Jay after being dumped by her boyfriend, they're shocked to discover that she's communicating with someone they know on a dating app

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A group of students face life-threatening weather on a hike and twin sisters survive a house fire thanks to their dogs alerting them to the flames

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers worry about one of their older cheetahs as they notice he has lost weight and his teeth are worn down. When they discover he has chronic kidney failure, they do their best to keep him hydrated but struggle to get him to drink more water. Kate finds out how the keepers are gaining the trust of their hyenas, Ben helps the emus cool off and Hamza spends an hour getting up close and personal with a Rothschild giraffe

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents live coverage of the third day from the All England Club, where the second round is scheduled to get under way in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Third seed Casper Ruud was an early casualty on day three last year, losing 3-6, 6-2, 7-5, 6-4 to Ugo Humbert

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: A Scottish Service of Thanksgiving for King Charles III
programme.desc: King Charles III and Queen Camilla are presented with the Honours of Scotland

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents further live coverage of the third day from the All England Club, featuring second-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. British number one Emma Raducanu's tournament came to an abrupt end at this stage last year when she was beaten 6-3, 6-3 by France's Caroline Garcia. However, there was better news for the home crowd on the No. 1 Court, where ninth seed Cameron Norrie prevailed in five sets against Jaume Munar of Spain

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents, as live coverage of the third day concludes at the All England Club, where second-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions take place. Two-time champion and home favourite Andy Murray's tournament came to an end at this stage last year on Centre Court when he was beaten in four sets by American John Isner, who is perhaps best known for winning the longest professional tennis match in history here in 2010 against Nicolas Mahut

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: As they compete for a place in the quarter final, Sara Pascoe takes the sewers back to the 1990s. In the Pattern Challenge, the competitors make the most popular trousers of the decade, cargo pants, before rustling up a '90s celebrity-themed fancy dress outfit in the Transformation Challenge. In the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers make dresses fit for a '90s supermodel

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Kiri Pritchard-McLean rewinds the most engaging clips from half a century of Welsh TV, this time looking at Ynys Mn or Anglesey. From stunning scenery to marvellous characters, she finds out how the place she calls home has made an impact in Wales

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Medical doctors, science broadcasters and identical twins Chris and Xand van Tulleken team up to research their family tree. They grew up surrounded by old paintings and documents commemorating characters from their Dutch ancestry, but despite this wealth of family archive, the twins know little about their heritage. Their journey takes them back to the Netherlands, where they look into the career of sea captain Jan Tulleken, their four-times great-grandfather, a staunch royalist who joined the Dutch navy at 13. But as they trace the story back, they reveal a troubling story

programme.title: The Railway Man (2013)
programme.desc: A traumatised former prisoner of war gets married, but continues to suffer nightmares about his experiences. He is unable to talk to his wife about his time in captivity, so she tracks down a fellow hostage to learn the truth - and discovers the cruel Japanese officer he is fixated on is still alive. Fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Nicole Kidman and Stellan Skarsgard

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers worry about one of their older cheetahs as they notice he has lost weight and his teeth are worn down. Kate finds out how the keepers are gaining the trust of their hyenas, Ben helps the emus cool off and Hamza spends an hour getting up close and personal with a Rothschild giraffe

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents, as live coverage of the third day concludes at the All England Club, where second-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions take place. Two-time champion and home favourite Andy Murray's tournament came to an end at this stage last year on Centre Court when he was beaten in four sets by American John Isner, who is perhaps best known for winning the longest professional tennis match in history here in 2010 against Nicolas Mahut

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: As they compete for a place in the quarter final, Sara Pascoe takes the sewers back to the 1990s. In the Pattern Challenge, the competitors make the most popular trousers of the decade, cargo pants, before rustling up a '90s celebrity-themed fancy dress outfit in the Transformation Challenge. In the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers make dresses fit for a '90s supermodel

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: Lenny and Lydia spend time with Callum to take their minds off the police investigation, while Mikey discovers Ash has been lying to Gillian. Elsewhere, Angus and Rebecca have an overdue heart to heart

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Medical doctors, science broadcasters and identical twins Chris and Xand van Tulleken team up to research their family tree. They grew up surrounded by old paintings and documents commemorating characters from their Dutch ancestry, but despite this wealth of family archive, the twins know little about their heritage. Their journey takes them back to the Netherlands, where they look into the career of sea captain Jan Tulleken, their four-times great-grandfather, a staunch royalist who joined the Dutch navy at 13. But as they trace the story back, they reveal a troubling story

programme.title: The Railway Man (2013)
programme.desc: A traumatised former prisoner of war gets married, but continues to suffer nightmares about his experiences. He is unable to talk to his wife about his time in captivity, so she tracks down a fellow hostage to learn the truth - and discovers the cruel Japanese officer he is fixated on is still alive. Fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Nicole Kidman and Stellan Skarsgard

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A man narrowly escapes death in a remote ravine after his dog alerts local walkers of his plight, and a car enthusiast faces dire consequences when he buys back a favourite motor

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate helps put a lion pride into another lion's territory to analyse the current social structure. The keepers carry out essential health checks on the park's new red pandas

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit a three-bedroom terrace in Rugby, a former working men's club in Bolsover and a three bedroom semi in Nottingham which are all up for sale at online auctions. The team follows progress on building work to see if any of the developers can turn a profit on their investments

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents today's show from Hele in Devon, and visits a Victorian catacomb. The reds and the blues are led by John Cameron and Stephanie Connell

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Novak Djokovic will be first up on Centre Court, having won his fourth consecutive title here and his seventh overall after overcoming Nick Kyrgios in the 2022 final. Having already won the Australian and French Opens this year, Djokovic is aiming to become the first man since Rod Laver in 1969 to win all four Grand Slam events in the same year. One of his main challengers could well be Carlos Alcaraz, who is the last man other than Djokovic to win a Grand Slam, having won the US Open in 2022, which contributed to a spell at the top of the world rankings

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. In the ladies' competition, there were straight-set victories for eventual runner-up Ons Jabeur and second seed Anett Kontaveit over MIrjam Bjorklund and Bernarda Pera on day one last year. In the men's event, Wimbledon continued to be the one Grand Slam that has eluded Stan Wawrinka, when he lost 7-5, 4-6, 6-3, 6-2 to a man 17 years his junior in Jannik Sinner

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: After 15 years of fostering, Stephen and Lynn Smedley were looking forward to their well-earned retirement in Carbis Bay, Cornwall. However, the dream dramatically changed when their daughter died, leaving them caring for their three grandsons. The boys, still grieving for their mum's untimely death, are forced to share a single bedroom with a triple bunkbed. There is only one bathroom and Lynn is forced to do the ironing in the shed due to lack of space. Enter Nick Knowles and the team. Their plan is to reconfigure and enlarge their home to accommodate three growing boys - with the help of hundreds of volunteers

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Murder in the Badlands
programme.desc: The inside story of the murder of 18-year-old German backpacker Inga Maria Hauser and contains powerful testimony from her surviving family. In 1988, Inga's body was found at the end of a dark track within the most remote part of Ballypatrick Forest

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Lola and Jackson find one thing they can agree on after interviewing Freddy. Freddy and Baba seize upon an opportunity to solve two problems with another killing

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team celebrate the 75th anniversary of the National Health Service by restoring items chronicling the evolution of the publicly funded healthcare system. First into the barn are nurses Catherine and Katie who bring metal-man Dominic Chinea a Thomas the Tank Engine food trolley from the children's ward at Frimley Park Hospital in Surrey, having been a feature on the ward for over 30-years, it has started to show its age. Bookbinder Chris Shaw is given the task of repairing the daily diary kept by nurses and carers who took care of author and poet Michael Rosen while he was in a 40-day induced coma at the start of the pandemic. Dr Adrian and his daughter Lydia bring in a 1960s GP's bag that belonged to Adrian's late father Noel. Leather expert Suzie Fletcher teams up with silversmith Brenton West to repair the bag and the medical instruments inside. Will Kirk is tasked with revamping an old wooden desk that Bill saved from being thrown away when he was a student at nursing school in
