programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A dad performs CPR on his toddler with help from a 999 call handler and emergency services rush to help a retired man who crash landed his aircraft in a field

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The zookeepers notice that the wolves have been digging a lot just recently, causing them to suspect that the mother of the pack could be pregnant. Ben Fogle gets an update on three-year-old tiger Yuki and Kate Humble mourns the loss of one of the park's legendary animals

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph catches up on the development of five flats in Crystal Palace while Martel Maxwell follows a group with potential in Stoke. Tommy Walsh talks to a teacher who has a vision to create a family home in Bexleyheath that combines a modern feel while retaining period features

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Southwell, Nottinghamshire, and dives into the surprising history behind the humble bar of soap. With Steph Connell and Mark Stacey

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the second day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Elena Rybakina is scheduled to get proceedings under way on Centre Court this afternoon following her victory over Ons Jabeur in the 2022 final. As 2021 title-winner Ashleigh Barty had retired, the honour normally reserved for the champion fell to top seed Iga Swiatek last year, and she claimed a routine 6-0, 6-3 victory over qualifier Jana Fett. She was followed by Rafael Nadal, who prevailed in four sets against Francisco Cerundolo, but the two-time champion looks set to miss out this time around due to injury

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the second day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Serena Williams was unable to add to her seven singles titles here when she fell at the first hurdle to Harmony Tan at this stage last year. However, there were victories for two other former ladies' champions, with Simona Halep and Petra Kvitova overcoming Karolina Muchova and Jasmine Paolini respectively

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Dan and Kelly Waller cleared a packed garage to create an annex for grandparents to live, but as a result the clutter that was there has now taken over the rest of the house. With Stacey's help, the family starts packing all its possessions into boxes and those are later laid out in a giant warehouse like an art installation of their entire lives. Back at the house, carpenter Robert Bent creates a multi-purpose spare room and transforms the office into a workspace of dreams, cleaner Iwan Carrington gives the home a supersize spring clean, while organiser Dilly Carter reveals the best way to organise paperwork

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at how the conflict became an intelligence war, as the police and the army made efforts to infiltrate paramilitary organisations and recruit informers. Anne Marie reveals how a loyalist gun attack at a funeral in Milltown Cemetery in West Belfast in 1988 prompted her to plant firebombs in city centre shops, primed to explode at night. She then became caught up in an intelligence web of informers and interrogation.

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: Despite the danger that leaving the cell puts him in, Mobeen heads to see Jamal in response to a call for help - only to encounter Megalodon on the way. Just when it looks like Megalodon is about to batter Mobeen, Officer Saj intervenes, leaving Mobeen free to help Jamal, which he does with help from an unlikely source. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Youssef Kerkour

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: Megalodon throws the prison into a full-blown riot. Mobeen, Nate and Harper split off into different groups. Mobeen is concerned with Dr Nida's safety, while also trying to keep Memory Stick on side. Uncle Shady ends up with Memory Stick, with both of them trying to evade Megalodon and a wing full of rioting inmates. However, as the Tornado Team arrives, Mobeen ends up in the climactic showdown in which a number of revelations emerge. Comedy, starring Guz Khan and Youssef Kerkour

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Sam and Jay travel to where Sam's mother died to see if she's now a ghost, while Sasappis divulges a secret to his fellow ghosts that he overheard Sam and Jay discussing

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: When Jay's sister comes to visit Sam and Jay after being dumped by her boyfriend, they're shocked to discover that she's communicating with someone they know on a dating app

programme.desc: Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: The town's dance troupe is in distress, meaning that a musical score must be handled with extra care

programme.title: Alleluia! (Spiritual Music & Verse)
programme.desc: Seona Brown sings Ghridh ar D, O Ghridh gun Choimeas, and John Archie MacMillan quotes from the renowned speech by Martin Luther King, I Have a Dream

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Nannag a' Noo/Huggleboo

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: The little bunny looks forward to an ice-cream

programme.title: Lon le Linda
programme.desc: Linda Macleod and her friends prepare a number of tasty dishes. Then, Beth and Isaac join her to make a coconut and blackberry cake

programme.title: Abadas
programme.desc: The friends play Hari's super game, but things are tougher than they seem

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: Pip and Posy meet their friends for a game of football, but things go wrong when Posys bag causes a lot of commotion

programme.desc: Arthur Cormack reads An Stad mu Dheireadh air Srid a' Mhargaidh, written by Matt de la Pea, illustrated by Christian Robinson and translated into Gaelic by Jo Macdonald

programme.title: Bogaisean is Gumbalan/Bottersnikes and Gumbles

programme.title: Na Dana-thursan aig Tintin/The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: In his attempt to reach King Ottakar and his Sceptre before the thieves do, many obstacles are placed before Tintin, but he and Dileas manage to escape

programme.title: Ceathrar air Chuairt

programme.desc: Celebrating 25 years of the HebCelt Festival. Featuring behind-the-scenes stories and performances from some of the great artists who have headlined the festival

programme.title: OMC!
programme.desc: Sketch show featuring a collection of comic characters, unrequited love and comedy horror. Including an intimate dining experience and an embarrassing confrontation in the shopping aisle

programme.title: Arnish
programme.desc: Memories from those who worked at the Arnish oil yard, who explain the significant impact it had on the town of Stornoway and indeed on the island as a whole

programme.title: Bannan (The Ties That Bind)
programme.desc: Alasdair excuses himself to the city without telling Miri the real reason for his visit, only to come home and find Miri and Donneil together - and close. programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul heads to the mental health unit, where he joins 10-year-old Tourette's sufferer Oscar at a group therapy session where the youngster hopes to buuild up his confidence. programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh prepares a surprise for Rob and Margaret Isdale, a Grantham couple in their seventies who have fostered more than 150 children over the past 45 years. Alan draws inspiration from Frances Hodgson Burnett's novel The Secret Garden, creating ancient looking follies and winding paths, and even turning a normal garden shed into a mock-Tudor feature

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen return to host the celebrity cookery competition, as eight stars and their chef mentors compete in culinary cook-offs. programme.title: Secrets of the Spies
programme.desc: The new frontier of cyber spycraft and warfare, and how whistle-blowers and leaks have become more prevalent, with figures such as Edward Snowden seeking to expose the manipulation and state of play of modern espionage. From false papers to fake news, this episode explores the art of disinformation, blackmail and exploitation to deceive the enemy, and the changing threats and tactics employed by terrorists and spies in the late 20th century onwards

programme.title: Secrets of the Bay City Rollers
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell goes in search of the Bay City Rollers - tartan-clad idols from his own home town of Edinburgh who became one of the biggest pop bands of the 1970s - and learns the dark secrets of the abusive Svengali who managed them. He interviews some former members of the band, which took the charts by storm with hits like Shang-A-Lang and Bye Bye Baby, and learns how, as their fame faded, it became clear their manager Tam Paton was not the champion and protector he appeared

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Local landowner Les Parnaby loses patience with ramblers wandering across his land and resolves to take matters into his own hands - regardless of the cost. Meanwhile, Ventress's car accident has a strange effect on Vernon Scripps, much to the delight of his many creditors. Rural police drama, starring Lloyd McGuire, Geoffrey Hughes and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police leap into action when a labourer at the Kirkbys' farm dies of strychnine poisoning, believing a killer is on the loose. As the finger of suspicion moves from one villager to another, the scene is set for tragedy. Meanwhile, the Ashfordly Rotary Club pensioners head for the seaside town of Whitby - but David's mangy mutt Alfred proves to be something of a liability

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As plans to build a new police station lead Morse to question his place in the force, he investigates the case of Tommy Cork, a boy from a broken home who has disappeared. Meanwhile, the body of disreputable journalist Eric Patterson has been found on railway tracks in mysterious circumstances. He was last seen embroiled in an argument with a council official about a company preparing to redevelop the site of Blenheim Vale, a disused correctional facility for boys. When a petty criminal with a connection to Blenheim absconds from an open prison, it sets off a chain reaction of events that threaten to expose horrors of the past. Did missing Tommy witness something that cost him his life?

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks agrees to help old friend and partner Jimmy Valentine with an undercover drug sting, but when the bust goes wrong and a dealer ends up dead, suspicion falls on the officers. As Devlin pushes for the truth, the spotlight turns on Brooks' dark past, and a 10-year-old case involving no witnesses and a large quantity of missing heroin. Guest starring Hustle's Robert Glenister, former Rising Damp star Don Warrington and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral), alongside Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Freema Agyeman

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: After dealing with the repercussions of her actions from last year, DC Lisa Armstrong is given the opportunity to step up when asked to assist a murder investigation in Morecambe. Tensions remain high as Lisa struggles to do her job whilst following the orders of her previously lower ranking colleague, Med. As the team tries to uncover why the victim was targeted, Lisa and her children are unknowingly stalked by a mysterious figure. Return of the crime drama, starring Morven Christie, Daniel Ryan and Stephen Tompkinson

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The residents are pleased when a fair comes to Elsinby, but Jeffrey and Samantha have their work cut out when the waltzer operator becomes trapped in the ride's mechanism. He's rushed to the hospital, where Mr Rose operates, and reveals his father has been suffering dizzy spells recently. A concerned Jeffrey heads back to the fairground, but he's too late to prevent disaster. Meanwhile, Ken hatches a dubious money-making scheme and Jill is forced to confront a patient's wife. Paul Fox, Anna Madeley and Amy Robbins star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A group of drunken mods arrive at the hospital in a shocking state, and Ken Hopkirk soon makes the grim discovery that they have been drinking industrial alcohol supplied by their friend, theatre technician Alun Morris. Meanwhile, a fourth member of the boozing group is brought in and has his stomach pumped immediately - but it soon emerges that the illicit hooch has blinded him. Elsewhere, Mr Rose and his surgical team treat a widow with a gangrenous toe at her farmhouse, and student nurse Samantha Beaumont receives a telling-off for laying out operating instruments in an incorrect order. Andy Wear, Michael Starke and Robert Daws star, with a guest appearance by Thelma Barlow

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Zoe surprises Scott with a tempting offer, Marlon receives welcome news and Terry refuses to help Charity, vowing to stay loyal to Chris. Bob does his best to entertain his patient, but it's not easy

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Zoe promises to keep Terry's job open while he recuperates, as she sets out to manipulate witnesses in Charity's case. Marlon gives cause for concern and Chloe aims to profit from others' misfortune

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail is amazed to discover the police suspect her of being involved in Richard's dodgy dealings, Peter makes the most of Shelley's absence to visit fiancee number two, and Ashley returns to work - only to discover Fred's housekeeping skills leave a lot to be desired

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: David and Sarah eagerly await their return to school as Gail's mood fails to improve, while Jack and Vera make things worse by selling their story to a local paper

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Mrs Roper discovers a cheap holiday scheme that requires the couple to join the Conservative Party - but George is a staunch Labour supporter

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: The Ropers suffer a domestic crisis when Mildred discovers George has been writing to another woman. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The hospital staff have an intriguing case on their hands when local tramp Sebastian Fox is found dead. Ken Hopkirk rummages through his belongings and is surprised to find war medals, leading to the discovery that he was a decorated Navy hero. When a relative is traced but refuses to help with funeral arrangements, the Royal team decide to give him a fitting send-off by scattering his ashes at sea. Meanwhile, Jeffrey Goodwin is shocked to discover a farmer's cattle herd have contracted a disease which has passed into cheese that's available in the area, and Jill Weatherill, Matron and Sister Brigid encounter a runaway girl. Rural medical drama, starring Michael Starke and Wendy Craig

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Ormerod is furious to discover the police have launched an investigation into his wife's death, and reveals in a heated outburst that she was planning to leave him at the time of the accident. Bad news strikes a family when it emerges a couple's son is showing signs of a hereditary heart disorder, a mother-to-be suffers kidney failure during childbirth and hospital porter Ken Hopkirk needs an operation after injuring himself while lifting a piano. Romance blossoms for Dr Goodwin and student nurse Samantha Beaumont, and Lizzie Kennoway's driving lesson ends in disaster when she slams into the back of Mr Harper's parked car. Rural medical drama, starring Robert Daws, Simon Molloy, Amy Robbins and Paul Fox

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity grows convinced her future lies behind bars, while Zoe buys Terry's silence and makes Scott an extraordinary offer he cannot refuse. Debbie and Daz take a joyride to trouble

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Bent on revenge, Vera remains unmoved by Gail's plight and even goes out of her way to make sure her devastated neighbour sees the story she and Jack sold to the newspaper, while Peter prepares to make a confession

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail resolves to pull herself together and face the world again, Craig lands in hot water with Tommy, and Karen's confidence takes a knock thanks to Janice's meddling

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls asleep during a flight from Paris to London, while a female passenger is murdered by a poisoned dart, leaving few clues to the killer's identity. Poirot soon discovers she was a money-lender, which may provide a motive for the killing. The investigation is turned on its head, however, when the victim's illegitimate daughter comes forward to claim the inheritance. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with David Firth, Jenny Downham and John Bleasdale

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton tries to catch a thief who has been stealing tractors from farms around Aidensfield. Meanwhile, Vernon decides it's time to relieve a few more people of their hard-earned cash, and sets himself up as a horticultural expert and garden designer - but makes the mistake of enlisting David's help

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: There's much excitement in Aidensfield as Lord Ashfordly returns home with his new wife, and the villagers are pleasantly surprised to discover how glamorous and charming she is. However, a series of violent hijackings leaves the newlyweds shaken and in need of protection from Mike - but the intrepid officer's suspicions are aroused by the blushing bride's odd behaviour

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Bentham DeQuetteville falls to his death from a roof after seeing a headless horseman, his aristocratic family seem more concerned about their forthcoming Civil War re-enactment than the incident. As Barnaby and Jones try to discover the truth behind the ghostly figure, their investigation uncovers shocking secrets about the DeQuettevilles. Drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with James Callis, William Gaunt and Raquel Cassidy

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Two children go on trial for killing a toddler, each blaming the other, and the case hinges on whether forensic evidence can prove who is guilty of strangling the boy to death. CPS director George Castle defies his superiors and takes instruction from the victim's mother, who has a surprising point of view on the crime. Drama, guest starring Deborah Findlay (Cranford), with Bill Paterson

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: Determined to ignore Andy's unexpected arrival the night before, Lisa throws herself into the case and discovers a significant lead from her only eyewitness. The new information she attains opens up the investigation and the team uncover vital evidence, forcing them to deal with a difficult suspect. Crime drama, starring Morven Christie and Daniel Ryan

programme.desc: Cash-strapped George knows exactly what he can sell to raise money - but decides not to tell Mildred. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: An old flame of Mildred's turns up at the Roper house, prompting George to blow the cobwebs off his little black book. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Ormerod faces a taxing time when a prison van overturns on the moors. The driver is killed, a guard is seriously injured and one of the convicts escapes, while the others are rounded up and taken for treatment at the hospital, where Ken Hopkirk recognises an old friend. Goodwin fails to diagnose a serious case of post-natal depression - an error which almost ends in tragedy when the mother is found standing perilously close to a cliff edge - and student nurse Samantha Beaumont discovers she has an unexpected love rival. Penultimate episode in the rural medical drama series, starring Robert Daws and Paul Fox

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Ormerod faces a testing time when his father-in-law arrives demanding to know whether he was seeing Dr Weatherill while his late daughter was still alive. Following a heated exchange, it emerges that the disgruntled patriarch has hired a private detective to investigate the couple - but the situation only serves to bring them closer together, culminating in a marriage proposal. At the Royal, a painfully thin girl causes concern for Goodwin - whose green-eyed monster emerges when student nurse Samantha Beaumont agrees to a date with a younger man - and the hospital is evacuated after a suicide victim's corpse is brought in emitting toxic fumes. Medical drama, starring Robert Daws, Amy Robbins, Paul Fox and Anna Madeley

programme.desc: Charity unsettles Scott, who confronts Zoe, but is taken aback by her shocking confession. Daz manages to land himself in trouble again and Steph struggles to deal with her grief

programme.desc: Gail heads off to the solicitors full of hope for a bright future without her murderous husband, little realising he's been watching her every move - and has still got a couple of tricks up his sleeve

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: With the children securely bound and gagged in the car, conniving killer Richard explains his final, desperate decision to a terrified Gail - is there any escape?

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike joins forces with Scotland Yard when a gang of thieves turns up in Aidensfield, apparently plotting to steal a valuable horse from local trainer Kieron Doyle. The heroic copper doggedly pursues his quarry to the detriment of his relationship with Tricia - but tragedy strikes, leaving him heartbroken

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A magistrate does his best to protect a young troublemaker - until an embarrassing connection between the two comes to light. The village mourns the death of Dr Summerbee, who is temporarily replaced by James Alway, while Vernon wonders if he may regret an offer to help old flame Maggie Byrne. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the case of murdered entrepreneur Freddie Gill, whose body is found by bailiffs attempting to repossess his house. As she delves into the case, she soon comes to understand that Freddie's professional life is just as turbulent as his family life, and Vera must uncover whether the motive behind Freddie's death comes from the trouble at the heart of his family, a desperate financial crises, or his glances with organised crime. Starring Brenda Blethyn, Kenny Doughty and Jon Morrison

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When a 16-year-old girl is found dead in her home, Brooks and Devlin cannot be sure a crime was even committed. On further investigation, an unlikely murder weapon is uncovered and a suspect identified - a recently released serial rapist. Determined the accused is guilty, Steel pursues him with every power available - pushing the boundaries of the law to the limit. Crime drama, guest starring Kevin Doyle (Drop Dead Gorgeous), with Ben Daniels

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: As the team press on with the investigation, Lisa and Med dig deeper into the family and discover not all relationships with the victim were amicable. Starring Morven Christie and Daniel Ryan

What they don't understand is that Radley Crown and his dog are none other than the Blue Falcon and his dog wonder, Dynomutt (who are setting a trap for the Medusa Monster themselves). When our gang's interference causes the Blue Falcon to be taken by the monster, it's up to Dynomutt to put on his Blue Falcon hat and be the brains of the operation. But, he'll need a new Dog Wonder and he picks Scooby-Doo for the job!

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug reluctantly agrees to join a support group for overeaters - but sneaks off to hide in an abusive relationship meeting instead. However, his scam is exposed when he not only gains weight, but becomes terrified of Carrie

programme.title: Frasier

programme.title: Frasier

Jimmy Doherty investigates why there's more to frozen chips than just potatoes, Helen Lawal learns why frozen ready meals have best-before dates, Briony May Williams gets the inside scoop on soft-scoop ice cream, and Andi Oliver learns how to get the most out of your freezer at home

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at some of their favourite properties from the show. They begin in Cullercoats, on North Tyneside, where Mark and Suze Drummond have emotional ties to their Victorian townhouse - special memories that are making it difficult for Suzie to consider leaving. In Rushden, Northamptonshire, Susan and John Antoniou-Bailey are torn over their unique five-bedroom home. Susan loves its history and original features, but John has had enough of constantly moving between the disjointed, boxy rooms

programme.title: Evacuation
programme.desc: British soldiers come face to face with the enemy when Taliban fighters breach the airfield. But with the Taliban now in control of the country, they're forced to put old hostilities aside as they work together to control the crowds. Young soldiers must make life-and-death decisions on who is eligible for evacuation, while in the air, one pilot narrowly avoids a catastrophic collision - while the RAF must decide whether to overload aircraft to take more evacuees

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland visits Jordan in the Middle East with actor, writer and comedian Guz Khan, to visit the magnificent ancient city of Petra. But before they head to the wonder, Chris floats for the first time in his life in the Dead Sea, and the pair almost melt during an intense facial spa treatment. In Petra itself, they haggle with shopkeepers, ride camels and listen to tales told by candlelight, before ending their trip with traditional music and a Bedouin feast

programme.title: Dr Death
programme.desc: Duntsch attempts to gain privileges at another local hospital as Henderson and Kirby travel to Tennessee to conduct an interview

programme.title: I'm Your Man (2021)
programme.desc: To obtain research funds for her studies, a scientist accepts an offer to live with a humanoid robot, created to make her happy. Comedy drama, starring Maren Eggert and Dan Stevens. In German with English subtitles

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: The full story of Boris Johnson's friendship with press baron Evgeny Lebedev and his former KGB spy father, Alexander Lebedev. Including exclusive interviews with intelligence officials and senior political figures who warned the former Prime Minister against the friendship, knowing it would put him 'in a direct line of being able to be influenced and compromised'. Despite being told by both Britain's security services and the House of Lords Appointments Commission that the friendship was dangerous, Johnson ignored this advice and became the first Prime Minister to over-rule intelligence advice related to national security for a parliamentary nomination

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits PJ's Steakhouse in Queens, New York, to provide his expert advice to the owners. They decided to turn a successful bar into a high-end restaurant, but without any previous experience in managing a business they found themselves seriously in debt. With an over-confident chef and a partner propping up the bar, co-owner Madalyn faces a few difficult decisions

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets artists Indi and Rebecca, who are planning to construct a modern, larch-clad home on the Isle of Skye, with a second hand-crafted building alongside to use as their studio, all on a tight budget of 150,000. They have been saving for years, but making it happen will mean taking on the savage weather, not to mention the sceptical locals - and as if that weren't enough, most of the work is being done by one man, local builder Donald

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by comedian and author Rosie Jones for a journey round the Midlands exploring the best staycation retreats they have to offer. The pair begin in Rutland where they stay at the Rocket Lodge, an eco-build made of upcycled grain silos that boasts a wood-fired hot-tub, a circular kitchen and a disco bathroom. In the sand dunes on a strip of the Lincolnshire coastline, the duo stay in a rebooted 70s beach house called Sandy Feet where Sandi learns that 'Netflix and chill' doesn't mean what she thinks it does. They end their trip close to the Welsh border on the Walcot Estate in a 200-year-old hideaway known as the Wheelwright's shop that once lived 20 miles away but was dismantled and transported piece by piece before being rebuilt to look exactly the same

programme.title: The Change

programme.title: The Change

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Luca, a 31-year-old tiler from Essex, is hoping to polish up his love life by visiting the First Dates restaurant, and is keen to prove he's not the 'player' women judge him to be. His date is TV presenter Hayley, who may be confident on camera, but finds dating rather daunting. Next in is 72-year-old retired prison officer Sandie who, having modelled the first police-issue trousers for women, completed a Masters, and written a book, has lived a full life and wants to find someone to share an active retirement with. Her date is 79-year-old tennis coach Chris, who is also on the lookout for someone fit and active

programme.title: Untold: OnlyFans Got Me Fired

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Joe Lycett heads to the Austro-German border with his guest vacationer Roisin Conaty, spending a couple of days in the fairy-tale city of Salzburg. After checking in to the art-filled Blaue Ganz hotel, they hop into a horse and carriage for a tour of the city and an on-the-go three-course meal. They then embark on a forest-bathing workshop, attempting a series of exercises to reawaken their senses. Day two starts with a homage to Mozart. The duo reflect on the composer's music then sample the city's signature sweet, Mozartkulgen - aka Mozart Balls - a mix of nougat, marzipan and dark chocolate

programme.title: The Railways That Built Britain with Chris Tarrant
programme.desc: The broadcaster examines how trains transformed the nation and shaped modern Britain. He begins in the cab of Puffing Billy, the world's oldest-surviving steam locomotive, which was built in 1813 and designed to move coal along a five-mile stretch of track from a Northumberland mine to the docks. Chris also tells the story of Henry Booth, who not only championed George Stephenson's famous Rocket, but also helped finance it, and talks about the work of the navvies who dug the tunnels and laid the tracks

programme.title: Gregg Wallace's Big Weekend Away
programme.desc: Gregg heads to Barcelona, uncovering the city's artistic side in the incredible architecture of Antoni Gaudi, most famous for the Sagrada Familia, a large unfinished Roman Catholic minor basilica. The MasterChef presenter learns about the city's other artistic sons, while doing a self-portrait in the style of Pablo Picasso. He also visits the street festival in the Gracia neighbourhood, which culminates in the breathtaking castellers, or 'human towers', and samples the array of back-street tapas restaurants

programme.title: Jersey and Guernsey
programme.desc: This episode focuses on Liberation Day across the islands, where celebrations are underway to mark the anniversary of their liberation from Nazi occupation. On Jersey, cider and sausage producers Richard and Sarah Matlock pitch up to sell their produce, while on Guernsey, tearoom owner Robert shuts up shop to lead the island's Liberation Day celebration with a military vehicle cavalcade

programme.desc: Hannah escapes her attacker and tells Tony she was targeted because of what she saw on CCTV, and his curiosity is aroused when she shows him the photo of the discarded T-shirt and even more so when he sees the CCTV footage

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: Road policing officer Sgt Gladwin and PC Hammond are called out when a van with a trailer crashes on a motorway on the Avon and Somerset border. programme.title: Great British Ships
programme.desc: Rob Bell reveals the secrets of ill-fated liner the Titanic, whose maiden voyage became the most famous maritime disaster in history. In the Belfast shipyard where the Titanic was built, Rob explores how the city took on the daunting challenge of creating such a gigantic ship, and as the tragic story unfolds, he demonstrates why its groundbreaking safety systems ultimately failed, costing the lives of more than 1,500 people

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Single-mum Anna, who lives on the breadline, swaps lifestyles with two successful men who live in apartments in a Victorian mansion in Leeds. Anna lives in the small town of Keighley and her minimum-wage job leaves her with less than 60 a week for food, clothes and emergencies. In contrast, best mates Matt and Daniel have the money to indulge in luxuries and plenty of time to spend with their children, and Matt even owns a fleet of luxury cars, including a chauffeur-driven Rolls-Royce and a yellow Ferrari

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A patient arrives at the surgery with a lengthy list of ailments she would like to discuss, and Dr Ashraf is up against the clock to tick off as many as she possibly can. Having recently been referred for suspected skin cancer on his arm, elderly patient Keith comes in to see Dr Arif about some worrying new symptoms, and Denise and Michael Peters see Dr Wyne to talk through Denise's epilepsy medication

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: To find out where thunder and lightning comes from, Monkey heads to London to visit the Met Office and the Science Museum

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Mayor Humdinger steals a ferris wheel from Adventure Bay

programme.title: Dead Reckoning (1947)
programme.desc: A veteran paratrooper is drawn into a web of murder, gambling and blackmail by the former girlfriend of an comrade, who went missing from a train while the men were on their way to awarded medals in a ceremony in Washington. Film noir murder mystery, starring Humphrey Bogart, Lizabeth Scott, William Prince and Morris Carnovsky

programme.title: Appointment with Danger (1950)
programme.desc: A nun is targeted by two murderers when they realise she is the only witness to one of their killings, and it is up to postal inspector to protect her and bring the men to justice. Noir thriller, starring Phyllis Calvert, Alan Ladd and Paul Stewart

programme.title: Arabian Nights (1942)
programme.desc: The story of two half-brothers - one the heroic caliph, the other an evil usurper - as they do battle for the right to rule their kingdom, and win the hand of beautiful dancer Sherazade. Adaptation of the classic adventure tales, starring Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu and Leif Erickson

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men (1955)
programme.desc: A law-abiding Arizona rancher runs into trouble when he unwittingly makes an enemy of a neighbouring landowner, who resents him for having befriended and comforted his abused mistress. The jealous man then recruits nine gunmen in a bid to drive his rival out of the territory. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Donna Martell and Jocelyn Brando

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, the third instalment in the successful franchise. Harrison Ford stars as the titular hero, alongside Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise

programme.title: Mission: Impossible (1996)
programme.desc: Secret agents suspect there is a traitor in their organisation when their latest assignment ends in disaster. The sole survivor is accused of being the mole, forcing him to go on the run to clear his name. However, in the process, he discovers a former Russian spy is selling information about the world's leading undercover operatives. Action thriller based on the 1960s TV series, starring Tom Cruise, Jon Voight and Ving Rhames

programme.title: The Firm (1993)
programme.desc: Harvard law graduate Mitch is headhunted to work for a prestigious law firm, despite his wife's warnings that it is too good to be true. After two of his colleagues are murdered, Mitch is approached by the FBI and informed the company is controlled by the Mafia - leaving him in a deadly predicament. Thriller, adapted from the novel by John Grisham, starring Tom Cruise, Gene Hackman, Jeanne Tripplehorn and Holly Hunter

programme.title: Playground (2021)
programme.desc: A young girl's loyalties are tested when she witnesses her brother being bullied at school. Writer/director Lauren Wandel's drama, starring Maya Vanderbeque and Gunter Duret. In French, with English subtitles

programme.title: The War Lover (1962)
programme.desc: Bomber commander Buzz Rickson is respected by his crew for his daredevil abilities in the air, but his personal life is a disaster. His co-pilot initially idolises the fearless airman, but over time becomes increasingly aware of his hero's flaws - especially when Rickson starts pursuing his comrade's girlfriend. Second World War drama, with Steve McQueen, Robert Wagner and Shirley Anne Field

programme.title: Dark Command (1940)
programme.desc: A teacher is defeated in his ambition to become the marshal of his town during the early years of the American Civil War, so he turns renegade instead. Before long he has a reputation as a feared raider fighting on the side of the South, and it falls to the newly appointed lawman whose job he coveted to stop his reign of terror. Western, starring John Wayne and Walter Pidgeon

programme.title: Hangman's Knot (1952)
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers wipe out a group of Union troops carrying a shipment of gold, but later learn the Civil War ended the month before, rendering their attack a criminal act. The soldiers go on the run with the loot, but their worries deepen when they are besieged by bandits. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Lee Marvin and Richard Denning

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone (1958)
programme.desc: A drifter rides into a town dominated by the members of a ruthless family. He befriends a Mexican in jail for killing a man who attacked his sister and tries to save him from the gallows, getting caught up in the evil clan's running internal conflicts in the process. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Craig Stevens, Manuel Rojas and Barry Kelley

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull (2008)
programme.desc: The globe-trotting archaeologist teams up with a rebellious teenager who draws him into a search in the Amazon jungle for a mysterious artefact of untold power. But their quest is hindered by Soviet agents who also want the fabled object for an altogether more sinister purpose. Action adventure sequel, updating the series to a Cold War setting, starring Harrison Ford, Cate Blanchett, Shia LaBeouf, Ray Winstone and John Hurt

programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2 (2000)
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt sent to find and destroy the only sample of a deadly man-made virus. However, he faces tough opposition in a former spy-turned-criminal mastermind who has already acquired the cure and now wants the pathogen itself. Director John Woo's action thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Dougray Scott, Thandie Newton and Anthony Hopkins

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July (1989)
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's fact-based drama chronicles the life of Ron Kovic, an eager-to-impress, patriotic Marine Corps recruit, who endures terrifying experiences during the Vietnam conflict that leave him paralysed from the chest down. On his return home, he undergoes a harrowing journey of physical and mental recovery that leads him to question the whole purpose of the war. Starring Tom Cruise, Willem Dafoe, Kyra Sedgwick and Josh Evans

programme.title: Career Girls (1997)
programme.desc: Two successful professional women are reunited for the first time since University, and recall the youthful insecurities and heady romantic trysts of their student days, tracing their development into self-assured adults. Mike Leigh's drama, starring Katrin Cartlidge, Lynda Steadman, Mark Benton, Kate Byers and Andy Serkis

programme.title: Yesterday's Enemy (1959)
programme.desc: A British officer leading a patrol through the Burmese jungle during the Second World War uses brutal methods to gain vital intelligence from prisoners, to the outrage of a chaplain and war correspondent travelling with them. When the unit is captured by Japanese forces, he faces similar treatment at the hands of his captors. Drama, starring Stanley Baker, Guy Rolfe and Leo McKern

programme.title: Fire Down Below (1957)
programme.desc: Felix and Tony run a tramp steamer together in the West Indies, but their seemingly unshakeable friendship is tossed aside when they both fall in love with the same woman. Tony tries to undermine his rival by exposing his illegal activities, while Felix responds with deadly intent. Romantic drama, with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon

programme.title: Tobruk (1967)
programme.desc: Jewish resistance fighters out to destroy Nazi fuel bunkers during the North African campaign recruit a Canadian major experienced in desert warfare. Risking life and limb, they pose as a German transport detail escorting British prisoners, but it becomes clear that someone in their group is a traitor. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Rock Hudson, Nigel Green and Guy Stockwell

A scientist learns the world is soon to face a global cataclysm that will wipe out the human race, but finds the US president has plans to secretly save a fraction of the population, leaving everyone else to die. A writer learns of this scheme, and as the world is devastated by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, he tries to get his family to the last safe refuge. Disaster movie, with John Cusack and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III (2006)
programme.desc: Former secret agent Ethan Hunt is called out of retirement when an ex-trainee is taken hostage by a ruthless arms dealer, but when the rescue operation goes wrong, the villain decides to target Hunt's fiancee. Action thriller sequel directed by JJ Abrams, starring Tom Cruise, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Michelle Monaghan, Ving Rhames and Simon Pegg

programme.title: American Made (2017)
programme.desc: A pilot is recruited to act as a courier for the CIA in the 1980s, carrying out covert deliveries from the US to General Noriega's regime in Panama. However, he exploits the opportunity to set up a profitable sideline trafficking drugs for a cartel. His dangerous double life takes a darker turn when he is ordered to supply weapons to far-right rebel groups operating in Nicaragua. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Tom Cruise and Domhnall Gleeson

programme.title: Demolition (2015)
programme.desc: A successful investment banker is left devastated by the death of his wife. A complaint to a vending machine company sets him off on a letter-writing campaign in which he makes a series of brutally honest personal admissions, providing him with the chance to make a fresh start in his life - as soon as he has finished destroying everything that used to matter to him. Drama, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Naomi Watts and Chris Cooper

With an over-confident chef and a partner propping up the bar, co-owner Madalyn faces a few difficult decisions

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When a curmudgeonly resident with few fans in the community passes away, the Butlers step up to host a memorial, leading Calvin to discover an unexpected revelation about himself

programme.title: The Neighborhood

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings

They've been married for 25 years and have two grown-up children, and think the time is right to buy their dream home in their favourite holiday spot. With a budget of 225,000 and five impressive properties to consider, Jonnie sets out to deliver this family's dream

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Portugal, a couple attempt to run a yoga retreat. In France, two Londoners plan to open a gte. A couple try to renovate a run-down house in Spain into a luxury holiday let

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.desc: Probate detectives visit Essex to search for the rightful inheritors of carpenter Ernest Wright's 200,000 estate. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the hidden lives of the animals of Chester Zoo. The Asian elephant family welcome a new arrival. Grumpy matriarch Thi has been pregnant for almost two years and is reaching the end of her tether. She's given birth to a stillborn baby in the past, so the keepers have a close eye on her. After a horrific accident, Darren was left tetraplegic and unable to move from the neck down. Darren's condition has meant his Cavalier ended up on the front drive. Darren's friends are hoping that Car SOS are able to convert the car to allow him to be a passenger and satisfy his need for speed again

programme.title: Guy Martin's Spitfire
programme.desc: In May 1940, a Mark 1 Spitfire was shot down and crash-landed on a beach in northern France, where it slowly sank into the sand. The wreckage was finally recovered in the 1980s and stored in France for more than 20 years. In this programme, motorcycle racer and mechanic Guy Martin joins a two-year project to rebuild the aeroplane, revealing the engineering and skills involved, and providing a fitting homage to the bravery of everyone involved in its service

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Spain, a couple prepare for their first guests - but there's a lingering problem. There's slow progress at a gte renovation project in France, and Covid-19 causes chaos for a couple's planned yoga retreat in Portugal

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole calls in a locksmith to bring a safe back from the scrapheap, and a ship's wheel is left in splinters when the presenter falls out with restorer Guy

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The death of Constance Harrington from Worthing, West Sussex, sheds light on a notorious 20th-century scandal, and investigators in the case of David Granger, who died in 2010, uncover a family mystery involving two brothers separated from their other relatives. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs need to be found

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives investigate the case of Margaret Snare, who died in 2010 aged 85, but discover her family history does not add up. Plus, they help a relative of Dorothy Warcup claim her inheritance

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Sancton, East Yorkshire and The North Star Club, owned by Carolyn Van Outersterp, who is joined in the competition by her daughter Galatea, where they hope their peaceful woodland cabins win over their guests. On arrival, guests Luke and John are critical of the cleanliness, and the pricing of the rooms raise eyebrows. At dinner, the reveal of a self-catering breakfast ruffles some feathers, but it's the lack of wi-fi that divides the guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Friends B&B in Blackpool, Lancashire, run by Luke and John Conway, where a lack of attention to detail in the rooms leaves one critic unimpressed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Lincoln Holiday Retreat, where guests Luke and John's great first impressions are muddied due to cleanliness concerns

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Chapel in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, whose owners Mark Hinchliffe and Heidi Donohoe, pride themselves on offering something a little different in their converted chapel. On arrival, the guests are wowed by the interior and artwork on show. However, Luke and John discover some grime underneath the glamour and Debbie is concerned about her traditional Chinese bed. At dinner, all the guests congratulate Mark and Heidi on their pretty property, but things soon turn ugly when talk turns to the looming payment day as it becomes clear that the B&B'ers have grievances to air

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The North Star Club is first and owner Carolyn Van Outersterp has some cleanliness issues she wants to brush up on after receiving a score of one earlier in the week

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chester's Penguin Island is home to one of the most enduring love stories in the zoo. At 22, Rud is the oldest on the island, and has been with his partner, Spike, for over 15 years. However, keepers are concerned that Rud's arthritic hip could be affecting his quality of life. Meanwhile, the Sumatran tigers are upgrading to a luxury new enclosure on the other side of the zoo as part of Chester's huge expansion. But they've lived in their home for most of their lives so it's not going to be an easy move

programme.title: The Dog House

An eight-year-old girl who always wanted a small dog has her mind changed when she sees stray labrador Leah, and nervous collie Kimmie needs another dog to keep her company

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Michelle Parsons, an artist and teacher who decided to seize the day and build her own private hideaway in a woodland environment in Essex after she recovered from a serious illness. Together with her architect husband David, Michelle planned to construct a sleek, black-clad, three bedroom house complete with an art studio. However, torrential rain and a potentially disastrous gas leak stalled progress on the build, and as construction gets under way, Kevin wonders whether the couple's decision to eliminate windows on two sides of the property may leave them living in a gloomy bunker

However, this is the first time Harish will be allowed to attend the birth of his baby. Nikita and James arrive for an elective C-section, having previously lost a baby at 24 weeks. programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Leeds and Preston in search of people's junk and clutter to upchucked into valuable new items. Henry makes an international set of clocks out of dashboard time pieces, while Simon builds an eccentric chandelier from car headlights

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team explores whether Robert Mead, who died in Thailand, had any relatives in the UK, and a man learns more about his grandfather's past as a member of Kitchener's Army during the First World War. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers discover the tragic life story of former soldier Arthur Jones, who left an estate worth 225,000. Plus, a nationwide search gets under way for the relatives of David Johnson, who are set to receive an inheritance of 37,000

programme.desc: The guests arrive at Harbour Vista in Poole, Dorset, where most of them have been expecting something lavish - so they are surprised to be staying in owner Steve Webster's house

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris Tarrant explores five countries that were part of Yugoslavia, which had an extensive state-run railway network before its break-up in the 1990s and the Balkan Wars of Independence that followed. From Slovenia, Chris heads east along an old Austro-Hungarian railway that was once used by the Orient Express, pays a visit to a very unusual railway-related battlefield in Bosnia and rides on one of the world's great mountain railways on his way to the Serbian capital Belgrade before finishing his journey in Montenegro

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The remains of a correctional facility in Atlanta, USA, forgotten remnants of fraud and fusion in Argentina and an ancient complex in Cambodia

programme.title: The Buildings That Fought Hitler
programme.desc: The impact of an integrated defence system and radar on the Second World War, focusing on the role of RAF Kenley, one of the most intact Battle of Britain airfields

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: A Japanese secret society's repeated attempts to kill Charlie Chaplin and Hitler's plan in 1942 to use educated dogs to do a soldier's job

programme.title: Secrets of the London Underground
programme.desc: Tim Dunn and Siddy Holloway explore the brand new Elizabeth Line and have access to two of its stations weeks before the line opens

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Continuing his trek from Philadelphia to Jamestown, Michael Portillo arrives in the nation's capital, Washington, DC, centre of political power in the world's most powerful country. Steered by his Appleton's Guide of 1879, he admires its fine public buildings, including the largest library in the world, and discovers how the capital was built from scratch after a political compromise between north and south. After this, he travels on to Mount Vernon, exploring a former slave market and visiting an archaeological dig along the way

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a journey from the Midlands to Rye in East Sussex, beginning by travelling from Warwick to Radley in Oxfordshire

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo picks up his rail journey from Warwick to Rye. In Reading, he traces the origins of education for workers, and in Cliveden explores a great Italianate mansion

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: 100 motorbikes come in for auction from every era of the 20th century, and the team assess a 1965 Vanden Plas Princess with a four litre Rolls Royce engine that's seen better days

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: A rusty 1970 Fiat 500 goes under the hammer - Derek reckons it's the kind of vehicle that is so iconic that it has to be saved

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues the final leg of his journey, meeting a survivor of the Coventry Blitz and exploring how the city has been rebuilt since the 1940 bombardment. Reaching Aylesbury in Buckinghamshire, he stops overnight at Hartwell House and visits the area's last pure-breed duck farmer, before heading to Watford in Hertfordshire to learn about Operation Pied Piper

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches London, where he continues to discover what remains of George Bradshaw's Britain. Arriving at St Pancras, he learns about the station's troubled history and 800million makeover, before travelling along the world's first underground line from King's Cross to Farringdon. The trip comes to an end at the Houses of Parliament, where he climbs the clock tower and meets the men responsible for keeping Big Ben working

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: Examining the complex system the Nazis set up to implement the extermination of the Jewish race throughout Europe from 1942, with Auschwitz as the hub. The programme reveals that at other camps, including Treblinka, Belzec and Sobibor, rival commanders participated in the genocide with enthusiasm and shared ideas for the best method of mass murder

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels through the Middle East to explore what remains of the colonial railways, which were built there more than 100 years ago. In the Wadi Rum valley, Chris boards a steam train along one of the few bits of the Hejaz railway that remains in working use, following the route through Jordan, before crossing the border into Israel as he heads for Jerusalem, which is sacred to more than half of the world's population. Along the way, Chris visits the ancient city of Petra, as well as Haifa and Tel Aviva

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The unfortunate fate of the world's first tank, which failed to make it onto the battlefield, and the case of the Japanese soldier who continued fighting - until 1974

programme.title: Secrets of the London Underground
programme.desc: Tim and Siddy visit Quainton Road in Buckinghamshire, 50 miles from London - and once on the underground. Siddy also explores Kingsway tramway tunnel

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Manassas, Virginia, scene of two crucial battles during the American Civil War. In Fredericksburg, he tries bottling bourbon corn whiskey and learns how it became the nation's spirit. In Richmond, the ex-politician enjoys a tour of the Virginia state Capitol building, where he hears of the dilemma faced by one of its most famous sons, General Robert E Lee, before donning his dancing shoes for a Cotillion ball. Michael ends his journey in Jamestown, the first permanent English settlement in North America

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches the capital on his rail journey from Warwick to Rye in East Sussex. In Ealing, he is transformed for the silver screen by expert hair and make-up, before travelling to Fulham, where he heads underground to explore London's new super sewer. Then, Michael visits the London School of Economics and Political Science in central London, before finally arriving in Kensington

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Piccadilly Circus to Gravesend, visiting an exotic West End store that was popular among Victorian women and hearing how a Russian ballet company took London by storm in 1909. He also discovers the origins of netball and gymslips at North Kent College and meets the pilots of the Port of London Authority, founded in the early 20th century

programme.title: Bangers & Cash

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the nation with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook to discover how the railways have affected people and find out what remains of Bradshaw's Britain. He begins by exploring Brighton's Victorian aquarium, the underground quarries of Godstone, Surrey, and the wonders of the Crystal Palace in suburban south-east London

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the next leg of his journey, learning about the London Necropolis Railway, a funeral service that transported coffins from Waterloo to Surrey's Brookwood Cemetery from 1854 to 1941. programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his American rail journey west to Jefferson City, Missouri, following the tracks of European settlers in the 19th century. In St Louis he ascends America's monument to the Wild West, the Gateway Arch, the tallest free-standing monument in the US. On the banks of the Missouri River, the political commentator is invited aboard a replica of the original keel boat used for an historic expedition. In Washington, Missouri, Michael tries to craft a corn cob pipe, and in Jefferson City he finds an huge fortified building that served as the gaol for the entire Wild West

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads from Warwick to Rye in East Sussex. In the orchards of East Malling, Kent, Michael discovers how the Edwardians' serious attitude towards cultivation bears fruit even now. In Folkestone, he hears how the town coped with an influx of more than 100,000 refugees fleeing the German invasion in 1914. In the High Weald, Michael heads for Tenterden Town and the light railway that opened in 1900. His final stop is the medieval Cinque Port of Rye, where he tours the home and garden of author Henry James

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of the 1930s as he sets out on another adventure. Beginning just outside Newcastle in Jarrow, Michael uncovers the desperation that led 200 men to march 300 miles to Westminster in order to petition the government for work. The first leg of his journey ends Spennymoor, Co Durham, where he meets the son of a miner who became one of the most famous 20th-century artists of the region

programme.desc: Beautician Claire hosts the third dinner party in Cardiff, but her decision to serve her favourite dishes on planks instead of plates proves controversial

programme.desc: Part-time football referee Scott serves up a menu of family favourites in Cardiff, but might have scored an own goal by putting cheese in every course

programme.desc: The final night in Cardiff sees restaurateur Giovanni cook a menu from his native Italy as he bids to wow guests Anna, Charlotte, Scott and Claire - and scoop the 1,000 prize.
