programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sports fan and rugby coach Matt loves all-things Italian and dreams of buying a holiday home near the historic city of Lucca in Tuscany. He's looking for a property with two bedrooms in a lively location, and brings along his best friend Shaun for some straight-talking advice. Jean Johansson secures the options of five properties for him to vivist within his 190,000 budget

programme.title: The Pennines: Backbone of Britain
programme.desc: A livestock auctioneer prepares for the biggest sale of his career so far, while a farmer in Ravenstonedale, Cumbria, uses goats' milk to make products from cheese to soap. A mountain guide ensures that walkers attempting the gruelling 24-mile challenge of Yorkshire's Three Peaks in under 12 hours make it to the end of their journey safely

programme.title: Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef
programme.desc: The battle to win the keys to the Palm Court restaurant in London's Langham hotel continues, as the contestants are tasked with reinventing the hotel's afternoon tea while staying true to its restaurant concept, and serving it to discerning diners. It's clear the hopefuls are willing to push the boundaries, coming up with everything from a Mad Hatter's tea party and edible soil to deer heart and delicate entremets. And who will dazzle the most when judge Michel Roux Jr invites them to host a chef's table with a few VIP guests?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nurse Emma is called to resus to help 71-year-old Thomas who has had a suspected stroke, and has a narrow window of time to give Thomas a life-saving drug. While treating him, Emma tells us the story of how she went from working in a dry-cleaners as a teenager to pursuing a career as a stroke nurse. At the same time, 88-year-old Mary is rushed to St George's after falling at home and injuring her head

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A cast of famous faces including Miquita and Andi Oliver, Mo Gilligan with Babatunde Alsh, Jamie Carragher and Micah Richards, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Big Zuu, Hyder and Tubsey, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, and Denise van Outen and Duncan James, comment on the week's TV

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith and journalist Clive Entwistle describe the killers' trial in 1966, and recall the tension in court as they faced justice, including the moment when a tape recording of a girl being tortured was played. The film also documents Myra Hindley's life in prison, and her protracted, unsuccessful campaign to secure her parole

programme.title: Evacuation
programme.desc: British soldiers come face to face with the enemy when Taliban fighters breach the airfield. But with the Taliban now in control of the country, they're forced to put old hostilities aside as they work together to control the crowds. Young soldiers must make life-and-death decisions on who is eligible for evacuation, while in the air, one pilot narrowly avoids a catastrophic collision - while the RAF must decide whether to overload aircraft to take more evacuees

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland visits Jordan in the Middle East with actor, writer and comedian Guz Khan, to visit the magnificent ancient city of Petra. But before they head to the wonder, Chris floats for the first time in his life in the Dead Sea, and the pair almost melt during an intense facial spa treatment. In Petra itself, they haggle with shopkeepers, ride camels and listen to tales told by candlelight, before ending their trip with traditional music and a Bedouin feast

programme.title: Ben Elton: The Great Railway Disaster
programme.desc: The comedian argues that railway privatisation is a failed experiment, travelling through Manchester's Ordsall Chord, an 85 million feat of engineering which currently only runs one train in each direction per hour, and experiencing Britain's worst railway line, the Transpennine Express. Ben reveals the results of a Channel 4 survey which asked 2,000 adults about their experience of using the trains, questioning how problems on the railways have impacted people's everyday lives, changing the way they travel

programme.title: Jon Snow: A Witness to History
programme.desc: The newsreader shares his unique experiences and what they've taught him about humanity in the course of his 32-year career as a world-renowned reporter and Channel 4 News anchor. Despite a lifetime reporting on large-scale trauma and bloodshed, Jon remains an eternal optimist, while wondering: can an individual really make a difference in this confusing and complicated world?

programme.title: Supermarkets Unwrapped
programme.desc: The Food Unwrapped team take a deep dive into the nation's favourite supermarket aisles. In this first episode, the team chill out in the freezer aisle. Jimmy Doherty investigates why there's more to frozen chips than just potatoes, Helen Lawal learns why frozen ready meals have best-before dates, Briony May Williams gets the inside scoop on soft-scoop ice cream, and Andi Oliver learns how to get the most out of your freezer at home

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Restaurant manager Stefano Scaringi hosts the second night in Wolverhampton, but has more than food on his mind, and an unexpected dessert drama causes chaos in the kitchen. Later, Kyle goes from chilled-out hippie to raging bull

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Happy-go-lucky hosts Jim and Justine kick off this competition from Portsmouth. The night begins in smashing fashion with an unexpected crockery disaster. When Leanne can't stomach either the scallops or peas, the others are left wondering whether she'll be a handful all week. After Jim reels off wisecrack after wisecrack, some guests fear he might become a little too much to handle. Leanne and Gary and Stewart and Lynn later take their turns as they try to win the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: In the Languedoc region, at Chteau du Puits es Pratx, Tim tries to make a complicated bamboo water feature for the garden, but Sasha struggles to see his artistic vision

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows Melvyn and Patricia Whitton five properties in Orlando, Florida. They have 180,000 to spend on a five-bedroom house for holidays in the sun, where they plan to invite their three daughters and eight grandchildren to join them

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: House-hunters Chris and Milton wish to relocate somewhere they can grow their own vegetables and indulge their love of culture, so experts Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman are on hand to show them a variety of properties in Dorset and Croatia to aid them in making their decision

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: The Rodriguez sisters help a couple find a holiday home in Alicante, which needs to have a private pool, off-street parking and a lemon tree for their gin and tonics

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max McMurdo and Simon O'Brien are in Woking, Surrey, where they find a sidecar - to be transformed into a boat - and a water cylinder that Simon might make into a trendy lamp

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gym fanatic Sophia Pottinger hosts the first dinner party of the week in south-east London, and has confidence in her simple, classic menu with dancing to follow. Sitting at her table are rock singer Francesca Santamaria, man-about-town Amadin Ryan, straight-talker Maria Eltheriouri and competitive cook Fraser Devlin

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Foodie Fraser Devlin hosts the second party from south-east London, and hopes his expertly cooked meal will land him the 1,000 prize. As well as organising entertainment for the evening, the host unexpectedly finds himself part of it

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rock singer Francesca Santamaria serves a music-inspired menu at the third party in south-east London, including starter Prawn to Be Wild and dessert Sweet Child of Wine. Her guests like the names but some are put off by the idea of fancy dress, and the discovery of a portfolio of revealing pictures prompts a surprise disclosure

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner party in south-east London sees host Amadin Ryan pulling out all the stops to impress his guests with a Victorian banquet. He seems to deliver the goods, but the extensive preparations keep him away from the table for most of the evening

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Maria Eltheriouri hosts the final night of the competition in south-east London, preparing a Greek-themed menu of meze, moussaka, and a marshmallow, chocolate and passion fruit mousse. In a bid to win, she ramps up the entertainment, with all the diners enjoying a dance, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Denise and Stephen are finally buying their first home together in La Cala de Mijas, southern Spain, after spending a lot of time apart in their long-distance relationship. The couple dream of finding an apartment with a pool and sea views that they can enjoy with both their families. Jean Johansson lines up five options for their 140,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Alison and Martin from West Sussex, who've just celebrated their silver wedding anniversary and also recently retired, believe that there's no better time to buy a holiday home on Spain's stunning Costa Dorada, where they can spend quality time with their family. With a budget of 120,000, they would ideally love to be a short walk from the beach. Expert Ben Hillman shows them five options

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets master craftsman Paul, who has muscular dystrophy and is saving a Victorian circus wagon. George also finds out about a grain store being re-imagined as a festival bar, discovers a small hotel disguised as a tree and a camping pod that looks like a giant conker

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody: The Home County Cartel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The covert team tries to find the true identity of Jaguar Palace, as well as the evidence to link the suspect directly to the drug-importing conspiracy. The detectives begin a nerve-shredding wait for the criminal network to set up its lucrative operation again, and stand ready to strike against the ringleaders when it does

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: Emilia Fox and criminologist Professor David Wilson focus on the disappearance of Suzy Lamplugh. The estate agent vanished after making an appointment with a client in July 1986. Despite the high profile of the case, nobody has ever been charged with Lamplugh's abduction and murder. Following a series of tantalising clues, Emilia and David narrow the field of suspects down to just one man. Will he reveal the truth?

programme.title: Evacuation
programme.desc: When a deadly explosion goes off in the sewage canal outside the evacuee handling centre, British soldiers rush to search for anyone who can be saved. Working through the night with medics, they save and treat thousands of injured Afghans and American Marines and as they pull back from the Baron Hotel, they close the gate on hundreds of vulnerable civilians. Ultimately, the 20-year war comes to a tragic and unsatisfying end as the RAF turn to airlifting their own forces out of the country

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor and Liam Charles welcome a new batch of pastry chefs to the tent and challenge them to create 36 individual opra aux fruit and one chocolate amenity in three hours. For their showpiece, the teams must transform a classic banoffee pie into a fine-dining experience with edible sculptures. Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden judge

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Three-legged labrador Dave seeks a new best friend, and his owners Laura and Paul hope that Luna, the beautiful but nervous saluki, will win Dave over. Nine-year-old stray westie called Norman gets much attention from mother and son Lorraine and Oliver - upsetting youngster Cynthia, a Staffie cross. Meanwhile, enthusiastic setter-poodle pup Obi might just win the chance to bring the joy and chaos that Mike and his partner Tracey don't yet know they need in their lives

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, as Roisin Conaty and Asim Chaudhry take on Jon Richardson and Josh Widdicombe. Bill Bailey is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on the Eurovision Song Contest, Beat the Chasers, The Queen's Platinum Jubilee Celebration, Lovestruck High, The Repair Shop, Drag Me to Hell, and ITV News coverage of the Jubilee pudding

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bally Singh decides on a student theme when he hosts the third dinner party in Wolverhampton, and his guests are stunned when he serves up beans on toast for his starter. Meanwhile, May Dudley has to endure another night of Stefano Scaringi's corny one-liners

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Glasgow, outreach manager Gill and accountant Mark kick the competition off with a night of comforting food and even more comfortable company. On day two, mischievous Derek pushes Matt's buttons and ends up being banished from the kitchen. On the final evening, a cooking disaster sees Cat blowing her top, but Martin saves the day

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Sasha gets creative making an elaborate bridal pathway at Chteau du Puits es Pratx, but Tim cannot resist playing a practical joke on her. Things get emotional for Christina as she and Sassan make progress on their pool and terrace projects at Chateau de Lassalle

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Steven Weald and Sue Upson search for a winter home north of Naples on Florida's Gulf Coast, and shows the active couple five properties that are within their 150,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jasmine Harman and Laura Hamilton assist Lisa and Tony Edwards, who want to buy a property in either Falmouth on Cornwall's south coast, or Kotor Bay, Montenegro, where they were married three years previously

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and son-in-law Matt search for a dream home in the sun for retired airline staff Darren and Tom who are looking for somewhere to settle for good after their travels around the globe. With a budget of 400,000 the pair look for somewhere with lots of outside space for animals that fits in with both Darren and Tom's differing styles. In Malaga, Shani and Andrew Hamilton help Suzan from Gibraltar who is looking for a place big enough for her four children and two grandchildren to visit that she can run her holistic therapy business from

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Herefordshire to meet former farmer Julian. Henry finds an old cattle feeder that he wants to turn into a garden bench, while Simon hatches plans to turn a vintage seed drill into a trendy dining table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: in Cardiff, DJ Trishna hopes her cooking will be even better than her rapping, as she hosts a hip-hop themed night in a bid to scoop the 1000 prize. However, when Yuno shakes his booty on the dance floor, opera-loving Nick is unimpressed and flirty Michelle lets her hands do the talking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the second day of the competition in Cardiff and Nick is planning to bring some refinement and fine dining to the week's proceedings. However, fastidious Nick really has set himself a mountain to climb with a massive tasting menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the third day in Cardiff, retail manager Yuno hopes to scoop the prize by whisking his guests off to the Himalayas. As well as entertaining his guests with some traditional dancing, Yuno's also hoping to tickle their taste buds by serving up Nepalese food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's day four of the competition in Cardiff and turn of self-appointed 'hostess with the mostest' Michelle. She's out to impress with a culinary trip around the world, but when she sets a fun challenge, she ends up being accused of cheating

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night of the competition in Cardiff, host Suzanne is pinning her hopes on an evening of sophistication and fine French cuisine. Suzanne's menu is inspired by her many holidays to France - in fact she's been every year for the last 17 years. However, revealing the inspiration behind her starter might be a step too far for her guests, especially after the revelations found inside her 'special' cupboard!

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps Ian and Emily find a holiday home in Pollenca, Mallorca on a budget of 440,000

programme.title: Britain's Best Beach Huts
programme.desc: Craftsman Jay Blades and interior design expert Laura Jackson travel the coastline as they compete to find the best beach huts Britain has to offer. Jay starts his adventures in Norfolk, meeting a fellow craftsman who's created a multi-coloured patchwork hut made of driftwood, before heading to Herne Bay where wedding bells are in the air at a beach hut on the pier. Laura's choices include a 1940s time warp in Hampshire and an inspirational owner making dreams come true in Essex

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Three-legged labrador Dave seeks a new best friend, and his owners Laura and Paul hope that Luna, the beautiful but nervous saluki, will win Dave over. Nine-year-old stray westie called Norman gets much attention from mother and son Lorraine and Oliver - upsetting youngster Cynthia, a Staffie cross. Meanwhile, enthusiastic setter-poodle pup Obi might just win the chance to bring the joy and chaos that Mike and his partner Tracey don't yet know they need in their lives

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor and Liam Charles welcome a new batch of pastry chefs to the tent and challenge them to create 36 individual opra aux fruit and one chocolate amenity in three hours. For their showpiece, the teams must transform a classic banoffee pie into a fine-dining experience with edible sculptures. Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden judge

programme.title: AI: Artificial Intelligence (2001)
programme.desc: A highly advanced robotic boy is created with one purpose - to love his owner as a parent. When he is rejected by his 'mother', he is left to roam the bleak landscapes of a futuristic America with a fellow android, searching for a means of becoming a real boy in the hope of regaining her love. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, starring Haley Joel Osment, Jude Law, William Hurt and Frances O'Connor

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody: The Home County Cartel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The covert team tries to find the true identity of Jaguar Palace, as well as the evidence to link the suspect directly to the drug-importing conspiracy. The detectives begin a nerve-shredding wait for the criminal network to set up its lucrative operation again, and stand ready to strike against the ringleaders when it does

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi and comedian, actor and writer Roisin Conaty explore Wales from the Pembrokeshire Coast to the English boarder staying in the best retreats the country has to offer. Starting with Seren Mor near the Nevern Estuary, Roisin is blown away by the contemporary architecture and dogs on the beach. Electric bikes take the pair over to Powys where they stay at the Hergest Lee Cabin and Lean-To, styled with quirky design and mid-century furnishings. Finally, the pair top off their escape in Moor Tower, a refurbished folly by Hay on Wye just a mile from the Welsh boarder boasting views of the Black Mountains, The Brecon Beacons and the Wye Valley

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets artists Indi and Rebecca, who are planning to construct a modern, larch-clad home on the Isle of Skye, with a second hand-crafted building alongside to use as their studio, all on a tight budget of 150,000. They have been saving for years, but making it happen will mean taking on the savage weather, not to mention the sceptical locals - and as if that weren't enough, most of the work is being done by one man, local builder Donald

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back to some of their favourite properties from the show and offers tips and tricks to help viewers make the best of their homes. As well as catching up with some of the families that previously featured, Kirstie and Phil focus on the layout issues and dilemmas that many of us now face in a very different world

programme.desc: A landlord seeks urgent advice from eviction specialist Chris after finding his three-bedroom terrace has been stripped bare of the fittings, the flooring, and even the grass on the lawn. Landlady Rose gets a shock when she finally gains access to her property, and Dave from Peterborough Council's housing team comes across some of the worst damp and mould he has ever seen. Plus, Selina and Lee must return from America for a court case to recover 10,000 rent arrears on their UK property

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Police are called to a serious multiple-vehicle collision on the A64 that brings the northbound carriageway to a standstill, with the driver in the worst-affected car being airlifted to hospital with severe injuries. Near Scarborough, a VW Golf with no MOT fails to stop and clocks up speeds in excess of 100mph before colliding with a police car

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers close in on a suspected stolen car near Tadcaster, but they have to deploy two stingers as the driver tries to escape by hitting speeds in excess of 100mph. On the outskirts of Harrogate, a car with suspected links to supplying drugs is pulled over, with a search yielding narcotics with an estimated street value of over 12,000

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers swoop on a housing estate searching for suspects involved in a shooting and it needs to be a tightly controlled operation and communication is key between the firearms unit, police helicopters and dog handler Duncan. After catching one of the suspects, Steve receives a shock when he returns to check out the burgled house

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Steve is involved in a dangerous high-speed pursuit of a car stolen in a burglary. programme.title: The Kidnap and Murder of Lynda Spence
programme.desc: Documentary examining the mysterious disappearance of financial advisor Lynda Spence, who vanished without a trace in 2011 from her hometown of Glasgow. As the police launched their investigation, they began to uncover hidden multiple identities, links to suspected gangsters and property fraud which stretched from Glasgow to London. What followed was one of the longest murder trials in Scotland's history, but without a body, the case remained unsolved. Fast forward to April 2022 and police have reopened the search for Lynda, but will they finally find out what happened to her?

Grieving, yet furious, he draws on his hunting skills to become an adept killer seeking out revenge against those responsible. His actions soon spark a turf war between a manically unpredictable gangster known as Viking and a rival gang boss. Action drama, starring Liam Neeson, Laura Dern and Micheal Richardson

Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the case of a college professor pushed under a subway train - and the subsequent investigation leads to a man who had kidnapped his children and changed his identity 15 years earlier. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach

programme.desc: A respected financial analyst dies from an overdose of Viagra, a drug he was advised not to take. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates a ring of clever teenage partygoers when a string of break-ins takes place at the marine base in Quantico, and while working on the case, McGee forms a bond with one of the suspects

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man and his son on a fishing trip hook what appears to be the body of a petty officer, but the dead man turns out to be a journalist who had been investigating the proliferation of drugs in the Navy. Meanwhile, Ziva returns to her car after a workout at the gym to find her father Eli hiding inside. Guest starring Michael Nouri

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. After the deaths of two family members of NCIS employees, the team identifies the killer as a Swedish mercenary and the ballistics report reveals the bullets came from an Iranian arms dealer. McGee traces a wire transfer made to the hitman's ex-wife and son to an account under the name Virtue, and Ziva makes a connection after realising what the Hebrew translation is

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Jamie risks ruining his undercover work when he is hailed as a hero by the media for saving a baby from a burning building. Meanwhile, a dead firefighter's son prompts Danny to reopen a closed case - a decision that infuriates his fellow detectives

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Jackie are assigned to protect a witness in a major trial involving the Russian Mob. However, their presence does nothing to deter a would-be assassin from making an attempt on her life - and the detectives discover a leak from their department could undermine the entire operation. Meanwhile, Erin is offered an opportunity that could lead to her working even more closely with Frank

In Soho, police officers monitor the activity of the area's 100,000 nightly visitors from a CCTV control room in an underground bunker, while in Lambeth the air support unit is called in when an armed gang are seen rampaging through the streets

Their investigation then heads to the local community hospital where the victims were last seen alive. Starring Jeff Goldblum and Saffron Burrows

programme.desc: A disturbed young man with a vendetta against women seeks revenge for being snubbed and bullied in his past, which leaves Rollins in danger as she tries to stop an attack. Elsewhere, Benson tries to find the time to see her son in hospital

They believe he could hold the key to tracking down the most-wanted cyber terrorist in the world, who may be plotting an attack using a bomb containing a strain of the Ebola virus. When Khan refuses to co-operate, Ziva and DiNozzo take him to Guantanamo Bay to be placed with people he had previously betrayed. Guest starring Vik Sahay (Chuck)

Guest starring Valerie Cruz (The Following)

He explains that a photo-fit released to the media resembles him, and the attacks stopped during a period coinciding with his three-year stint in the navy. Meanwhile, Tony has to take probationary agent Ned Dorneget under his wing

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: When the prizes disappear from Mr Slater's new crazy golf course, the famous detectives Sherlock Sooty and Doctor Watsit are called in to investigate. Matthew Corbett guest stars

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Sooty asks the owner of a bird garden to save the day with his clever budgies when a circus fails to turn up to entertain Richard's guests

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Following his departure to Bulgaria, news of Gordon Brittas' apparent death reaches his colleagues at Whitbury Leisure Centre. However, Brittas returns from the dead to cause havoc and Carole is determined to save her baby from his zombie. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring Camden and Sydenham for locals and tourists.

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The King of the Unicorns steals Monkey's magic wishing staff, hoping to give it as a present to the son of the woman he's planning to marry

programme.title: It Always Rains on Sunday (1947)
programme.desc: A convict escapes from prison and heads for London's East End in search of his former lover, hoping she will give him a safe hiding place. She is now married with three children, and is torn between her loyalty to her family and her unresolved feelings for the fugitive. Crime drama based on Arthur La Bern's novel, starring Googie Withers and John McCallum

programme.title: Sky West and Crooked (1965)
programme.desc: A gypsy boy falls for a fey 17-year-old girl who is treated with contempt by her fellow villagers, but the mismatched couple are soon subjected to the deep-seated prejudices of the locals. Romantic drama based on the novel by Mary Hayley Bell, starring Hayley Mills and Ian McShane

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The crew is infected by a mysterious illness, and Tony must intervene before it is too late. Sci-fi adventure starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain, Tony Anholt and Dave Prowse

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: London's Screen Archives Presents
programme.desc: A series of hand-picked films celebrating London's rich history on film, from carnival scenes and community gatherings, to jubilee events and the Thames

programme.title: London's Screen Archives Presents
programme.desc: A series of hand-picked films celebrating London's rich history on film, from carnival scenes and community gatherings, to jubilee events and the Thames

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Reggie exposes his insecurities and much more during a disastrous speech to the British Fruit Association. But it soon transpires that it's all part of his master plan. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter and Pauline Yates

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: Exploring legends of London to get to the bottom of what's fact and what's fiction

programme.title: The Alan Clark Diaries
programme.desc: John Hurt takes the lead in this drama series charting the life of the politician from 1983 to his death in 1999, based on his infamous series of diaries, and following his constantly thwarted attempts to get into the Tory Cabinet. Appointed Parliamentary Undersecretary at the Department of Employment, Clark's initial enthusiasm soon falls foul of his taste for alcohol, as he turns up drunk in the House of Commons. Has his career ended before it's begun? Jenny Agutter and Julia Davis co-star

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion.

programme.title: The Dark Horse (2014)
programme.desc: A bipolar chess champion is released from a psychiatric hospital with nowhere to go, so moves in with his gang member brother. Needing a purpose, he forms a club to teach his skills to a group of underprivileged youngsters, but struggles with the strain of being a role model, particularly when his nephew seems set to follow in his father's criminal footsteps. Fact-based drama, starring Cliff Curtis and James Rolleston

programme.title: The Battle of the Sexes (1960)
programme.desc: An elderly Scottish clerk tries to sabotage the new methods introduced by an American efficiency expert reorganising the old-fashioned firm where he works. However, when he realises his boss thinks the new arrival can do no wrong, he is left with just one option - murder her. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Constance Cummings, Roddy McMillan, Robert Morley and Jameson Clark

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: Qantas Flight 32, which on November 4, 2010 suffered an uncontained failure in one of its engines, leading to a series of failures and a tense emergency landing

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William has his hands full trying to retrieve a body from Frankfurt as a favour to his late cousin's ex-wife, while Kate anxiously awaits her letter from Oxford University - but a postal strike adds to the tension. Elsewhere, Mary is put in an awkward position at work when a pregnant woman's partner makes a pass at her and Molly is forced to acknowledge the severity of her illness after being told she needs radiotherapy. Romantic comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Hannah Waddingham, Peta Cornish, Julie Graham and Cheryl Campbell

programme.title: Luther V Rome
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the beginnings of the Protestant Reformation, and how a simple monk challenged the might, power and money of the Vatican

programme.title: Resistance (2020)
programme.desc: Aspiring mime artist Marcel Marceau joins the French Resistance to save the lives of thousands of children orphaned at the hands of the Nazis, including Klaus Barbie, also known as The Butcher of Lyon. Writer/director Jonathan Jakubowicz's biopic, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Clemence Poesy and Matthias Schweighofer

programme.title: Forget Me Not (2011)
programme.desc: A musician comes to the aid of a barmaid being accosted by a drunk. Together they go on a journey around London and begin to fall in love, but as the night draws to a close, a secret threatens to bring their fledgling relationship to an end before it has begun. Romantic drama, with Tobias Menzies and Genevieve O'Reilly

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion.

programme.title: An Englishman in New York
programme.desc: John Hurt reprises his role as Quentin Crisp in this sequel to The Naked Civil Servant, picking up his story where the 1975 drama about the eccentric Englishman left off. Crisp sets off on the journey of a lifetime to the Big Apple, where the Americans immediately embrace the openly gay writer and his waspish ways, and before long he is being wined and dined by celebrities in every corner of Manhattan. But, as is so often the case with Quentin, he cannot resist making outrageous comments, and an ill-considered quip about the growing Aids crisis sees him suddenly dropped from high society. Sex and the City's Cynthia Nixon co-stars as performance artist Penny Arcade, with Jonathan Tucker, Denis O'Hare and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Crystal Palace and Shoreditch. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Underwater World for Kids

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Period drama re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens as inter-connected tales, set in a fictional version of 19th-century London. The likes of Oliver Twist's Fagin and the Artful Dodger live alongside and interact with the wealthy Barbarys of Bleak House, and the homely Cratchitts of A Christmas Carol, in events that eventually set up the stories featured in their respective novels. The saga begins on Christmas Eve, as Amelia and Arthur Havisham gather to hear the reading of their father's will, and the ruthless nature of debt collector Jacob Marley appears to give someone a motive for murder. Starring Stephen Rea, Pauline Collins, Caroline Quentin, Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton, Anton Lesser and Omid Djalili

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton returns to visit more islands off the coastline, beginning with the Outer Hebrides. He resumes his journey on Eriskay, where he discovers how the remote location helped preserve a unique way of life for centuries - and also allowed locals to hide thousands of bottles of whisky from the excise men when a ship laden with the thirst-quenching cargo ran aground in 1941. The story inspired the 1949 movie Whisky Galore! Moving on to Barra, Paul goes foraging for cockles and visits the only airport in the world where scheduled flights land on the beach, then heads across to Vatersay, where he joins local fishermen trawling for lobsters

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the Isle of Mull and its satellite islands to discover why they have become boltholes from the hustle and bustle of the modern world. He begins on the tidal island of Erraid, which inspired famous Scottish writer Robert Louis Stevenson, then hops over to Ulva, the final resting place of Lachlan MacQuarrie, one of the first governors of New South Wales. He then explores Mull itself, being given a whistlestop tour of the island by rally driver Louise Thomas, then travels to the mysterious little island of Inch Kenneth, where he hears the story of Nazi sympathizer Unity Mitford. He ends his tour at the remote Treshnish Islands, where he experiences a spot of 'puffin therapy'

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The King of the Unicorns steals Monkey's magic wishing staff, hoping to give it as a present to the son of the woman he's planning to marry

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The crew is infected by a mysterious illness, and Tony must intervene before it is too late. Sci-fi adventure starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain, Tony Anholt and Dave Prowse

programme.title: The Passing of the Third Floor Back (1935)
programme.desc: A mysterious Christ-like stranger arrives at a boarding house in London, and changes the residents' lives forever. Drama, starring Conrad Veidt, Rene Ray, Anna Lee and Frank Cellier

programme.title: Tarka the Otter (1978)
programme.desc: A mischievous otter faces a fight for survival in the wild from birth, as it leaves the nest and strikes out alone. Wildlife adventure based in Henry Williamson's novel, narrated by Peter Ustinov and starring Peter Bennett, Edward Underdown and Brenda Cavendish

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed and Mrs Peel visit a mysterious coastal town where several agents have recently vanished, and the locals are not what they may at first seem. Patrick Macnee and Diana Rigg star

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates chicken tikka masala, potato pizza, prawn pizzinis and chocolate muffins

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: Finally after four years of renovation, the scaffolding around Big Ben is coming down

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Growing Up Poor
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary about youngsters facing poverty, beginning with three teenage girls who are on the cusp of adulthood and are all surviving on less than 10 a day. Bridie's ambition to join the Army depends on her staying out of trouble with the police, while 16-year-old Amber has fallen pregnant, and Shelby is currently on benefits, but hopes the work placement she is on will develop into a full-time job

programme.title: The Dark Horse (2014)
programme.desc: A bipolar chess champion is released from a psychiatric hospital with nowhere to go, so moves in with his gang member brother. Needing a purpose, he forms a club to teach his skills to a group of underprivileged youngsters, but struggles with the strain of being a role model, particularly when his nephew seems set to follow in his father's criminal footsteps. Fact-based drama, starring Cliff Curtis and James Rolleston

programme.title: Winter of Our Dreams (1981)
programme.desc: Prostitute Lou encounters her dead friend's ex, who wants to discover why she committed suicide. A relationship develops between them, but when Lou acquires her friend's diary, she realises to her horror that she is repeating the mistakes of the past. Drama, with Judy Davis and Bryan Brown

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours of Charlton, Greenwich, Plumstead. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.desc: The chef demonstrates chicken tikka masala, potato pizza, prawn pizzinis and chocolate muffins

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: EFL Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Liverpool v Cardiff City. Action from the 20212 final at Wembley Stadium. The Reds had defeated the likes of Stoke City, Chelsea and Manchester City to reach the final and went into the match as clear favourites in their first visit to the national stadium since it was rebuilt. However, the Bluebirds, who defeated Crystal Palace on penalties in the semi-finals, had been in good form in the Championship and will have fancied their chances of producing an upset

programme.title: NFL: America's Game
programme.desc: Revisiting Dallas Cowboys' 1995 Super Bowl victory over Pittsburgh Steelers at the Sun Devil Stadium in Tempe, Arizona. Dallas tied the record set by the San Francisco 49ers in the previous year by claiming their fifth Vince Lombardi trophy with a 27-17 victory. They also became the first team to win the showpiece match three times in four years

programme.title: Fight Night International
programme.desc: Josh Taylor v Teofimo Lopez. Another chance to see the WBO World Super-lightweight title fight from The Theatre at Madison Square Garden in New York. Taylor became the UK's first undisputed champion to win four belts when he beat Jose Ramirez in 2021 to unify the IBF, WBA, WBC and WBO 140lb titles. This will be the Scot's first fight in the USA since that victory against Ramirez
